Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - that's it!”
Reviews.Author: N P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is near Macy's and Empire State Building. Everything is in walking distance. The location of the hotel is perfect, but that's it! A few nights was ok, but for longer stays I definitely would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: LudmillaMontreal
Reviews.Content: If you are reading this review, then chances are you're not able to afford the pricier places that will provide you with both location and amenities. The Lantham Hotel will provide you with an ideal location, and that is essentially what you are paying for. In a city where breakfast is not included in some hotels that cost over $300 a night, this hotel is actually quite reasonable; you'll have a clean roof over your head and a place to shower. But let's not get ahead of ourselves.This is a VERY basic place: the shower pressure was so low that I barely needed to draw the shower curtain. I only had to turn on the hot water faucet and even then the water was just warm enough, and the floor was uneven and clearly in need of a good scrubbing. Nonetheless, we slept there with no problems, my husband checked for bedbugs and found none, and the location could not be better! This is a good place for the budget traveler. As far as the staff is concerned, I had no problems with them. As a matter of fact, upon our arrival we were greeted by incredibly friendly staff, which was a good start to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier ...”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie W
Reviews.Content: I never really write reviews and usually I'd note in my head the reviews I read but prefer to go and experience it for myself, but after this trip, I feel that I have too as this hotel gets too much negativity for what it is actually worth. What you need to remember guys and girls is that despite this review, everyone is different. What my friend and I experienced in the 9 days here, you would not experience the same, even if you stayed here at the same time we did but I will continue with the review anyway. Me and a friend, both 22 year old female students from the UK, stayed here for 9 days (8 nights) and at first was a bit apprehensive at first because of the reviews however, ignored them and went ahead and booked it through hostelworld.com and we couldn't of been happier. (First time in NYC by the way) We arrived there at around 11pm (NY Time), paid the remainding balance and headed straight up to the room. Despite what other reviews have said, the staff are very friendly and say hello and bye when you leave the building and they speak perfect english. If you needed to ask them questions; where to go to eat, what bars were around etc they were more than happy to help and start a conversation with you, which unfortunately you do not get in many hotels. We stayed in a private double room with a shared bathroom on the 10th floor. We weren't too fussed with this as we were hardly going to be in the hotel anyway and we just needed somewhere to stay. The room was clean and spacious, you had soap and extra toilet roll in the room with a small sink. I wish I took pictures of it to post up, but never mind. They had a sign (The do not disturb ones) that you put outside of your room when you wanted the room tidied and this was done without fail just as you would expect any other hotel; clean floor, new towels, bed made etc. We heard no noise whatsoever despite my friend being a light sleeper. The bathroom again was clean, spacious with toilet and shower facilities. Cleaned everyday. The cleaners again, if we bumped in to them when we were about to go into our room or leave, they would say hello. We were completely happy to leave any thing we bought, in the hotel room while we were out for the day. The hotel environment was good, there were a lot of young mums staying there as well but this didn't phase us, why would it? The location of the hotel was brilliant. When you come out of there, there's a dunkin donuts on to your right on the corner (Excellent and cheap for breakfast) and there's a corner shop to the left of the hotel that does hot food, hot and cold drinks, sweets, snacks, medicine and other necessities you may need. And to the right of the corner shop (5th avenue) was the Empire State Building and a pretty good view of it as well. The Flat Iron Building was also located on your left. Across 5th avenue, further down the street was 28th street subway station, where the trains run from Queens through to Manhattan and then down to Brooklyn or vice versa. We were definitely within walking distance with most locations; 5th ave, Madison Square Garden, ESB, Penn Station and if not, as mentioned earlier you could take the subway as it stopped at all locations and more. Of course at night you have to be a bit more wary (Were in a country on our own) and you had the odd weirdo hanging out at the end of the road, but let's be honest, it is the same anywhere you go. If we had any problems, and I wouldn't even class this as problem, but I need to be honest, was that one that we had to wait for the bathroom to become free to shower and to be honest it wasn't that big of a deal, it happened maybe twice out of the 9 days we were there and in the end my friend decided to use the bathroom on the 9th floor where she did say that shower was more powerful, but nonetheless we still managed to shower. It was a shared bathroom, can't really complain and it's not the hotels fault, people just take a bit longer to shower/go toilet. The second problem and this was for me personally, was that there wasn't a heat adjustment in the shower and the water wasn't that hot. It wasn't cold either but I like to be able to turn the heat up when I shower and wasn't able to do this. But as I said, for me, not that big of a deal. So because of this the overall rating for this is a 4* I guess people were expecting the same level of service and interior design that you would get at The Plaza hotel but I suppose it depends on what sort of person you are. As the saying goes 'You get what you paid for,' and we did get what we paid for and were very happy. If you're like us, not fussy and need somwhere cheap to stay, then stay here. (And I say cheap in a positiive light) I am giving it 5* on the rating criteria as what I got superceded what I expected for the price that we paid. If there was a criteria for the bathroom facilities then yes that would have got 4. We felt safe and would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone who decided to stay here. Enjoy if you do go :-)

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: emmsyLB
Reviews.Content: I'm not too fussy about old decore, or something needing a paint, but this place needed more than that. OMG asside from the unhelpfull front desk, and the screaming women and children all night, there was a mouse visiting our room every time we turned the lights out and the shower drain was blocked so we were standing in filth every time we took a shower. It makes me cringe every time I think about this place, do not stay here, it's a good location so find something else in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend to own enemy!”
Reviews.Author: Zyk
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is location, but that's it!!! The service at the front desk is terrible, they are simply rude and speak a poor English. I'm generally a very easy going person, but the way they treat their customers is simply appalling. Now, the room. I stayed in a double bed room with a private bathroom. Walking to your room is like walking through a prison - going through multiple doors in a narrow corridor with walls painted in dark colours. The room is very small and old. It seems like it was never renovated since it was first built. Likewise, bathroom looks pretty bad too with pipes exposed and bathtub in a very poor condition. I can only imagine what the public bathroom is like. The light was constantly flickering. And the walls are so thin, you can easily hear people next door - people screaming on the phone at midnight and little kids crying throughout the night. I paid $100 for one night, and honestly, I wouldn't stay here again even if it was for free. So please do yourself a favour, and stay elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: kgulley
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent the weekend at The Latham I read all the reviews but we needed a place to stay that gave us access to everything on our itenirary I am glad I chose this cheap place it has a vintage feel to it I was comfortable. Everything is in walking distance we are both from nyc originally and know that everything is not glam we will definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is!”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaHelen
Reviews.Content: It's worth noting that I stayed in the Latham as a backpacker, I would not want to stay here if money wasn't my main concern (See my review on Affinia 50 when holidaying in NYC.) If you're on a tight budget then I could not recommend it enough! The location is absolutely superb, in easy walking distance of Macys, Empire State, Times Square etc. and has a lovely deli at the end of the road. Our room was fairly basic but met our needs. It had a fridge, tv, air con, comfy beds. We were sharing one bathroom with the whole floor but always found it to be clean and available. Mixed reviews for the staff! Our air con was broken upon arrival and they saw to it immediately that it was fixed and most of them were friendly. There is no concierge so don't expect them to be too helpful with organising your sightseeing. We were also there during Hurricane Irene and received no useful information about what to do in an emergency or any reassurance. We were also a little shocked at the end of our stay at the massive phonebill we had ran up regardless of the phonecard we were using and the compliant we had made about some broken keys and therefore charged us for every wrong number entered!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, serviceable, best price for NYC”
Reviews.Author: eryn_macdonald
Reviews.Content: After scouring the internet for reasonably priced hotels in Manhattan (an oxymoron in itself) we decided on Latham Hotel. The hotel was perfectly suited for tourists. ESB is right up the road and the subway is close by. We did a DIY tour of NYC and it wasn't hard or expensive to find our way back at night. We got an upgrade to en-suite on a high floor because they were booked out for the option we chose. The room was large, the heating worked well throughout the night in chilly winter and the traffic was not a problem at night. We are light sleepers. I can't remember but I think the bed was a bit small. The building is old, but I found the antiquated decor had lots of character. The old letter mailing system, large dialling telephones, many people would probably have issues with presentation, but the place is clean and you should rather allocate more of your budget to accommodation if you are picky. I am glad we booked at Latham. Would have no qualms going back there for another short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mice, egads!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianJP
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on New Years day at the end of our NYC trip. It was cheap with a great location so we couldn't say no. The room was basic and the bed was creaky but basically we just wanted a place to crash. I woke up in the middle of the night to a mouse jumping out of my backpack where there was a small amount of food I had left from the previous day. I followed the mouse to the wall heater besides the bed and found heaps of mouse poo all along the wall and under the heater. I called downstairs to see about a mouse trap which they informed me they didn't have any, but were happy to give us a new room without hesitation. I realize there are mice and critters everywhere, but in a hotel room where I want to be comfortable and sleep well, I would rather not know they are there. Clean up the evidence and set a few traps at the bare minimum. Besides that the trip was great, see you again one day NY! JP

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not a hotel...more of a place to leave luggage!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Doc472
Reviews.Content: This place cannot be beaten for its location, right in the middle of manhattan. Stayed with friends so the hotel room really meant nothing to us just a place to sleep and leave the bags....the rooms are tiny, you feel like your walking through a prison but we didnt care because we were there to see New York!! Stayed on the 12th floor, i think the lift only worked when we got there and when we were checking out!! definitely a hotel for people who do not care where they stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION - CLEAN ENOUGH”
Reviews.Author: maggimaggi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very centrally on Manhattan, perfect if you want to explore the island! It is both a hotel and an apartment building where people actually live, but that was no problem. Nice people at the reception, helpful and smiling. I shared a room with a friend, the room was big and clean with two comfy beds, a TV, a dresser and a fridge. The bathroom was OK, but the last morning we had an encounter with a well-known bug in the bathroom - not too pleasant, but we put the roach in the garbage and felt a bit more safe :) All in all the hotel was good value for what you pay, not at all as bad as I expected! I would recommend this hotel for budget travellers, as long as a cockroach in the bathroom wont kill you. WiFi in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE ROOMS!”
Reviews.Author: lyj911
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms, sheets,linnens and towels full of stains and hair. Carpet is sticky and even dirtier! Bathroom shared with an entire floor (10-15 rooms). Awfull in general! I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Agnieszka L
Reviews.Content: I've chosen this hotel because of its price and location. It's only one block away from the 28th St Station and a 7-minute walk from the ESB. We had a room with a bathroom for 2 persons, which was clean and tidy but totally basic. We stayed there in December 2009. I couldn't sleep at night because it was too hot and the radiator was extremely loud. There's a pension mainly for single mums in the same building but that didn't cause any problems.There's a deli on the corner with quite good food and reasonable prices.The building would be nice and decadent when renovated properly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless your desparate”
Reviews.Author: Eden C
Reviews.Content: If you want somewhere cheap with powerpoints/light switches hanging off the wall, a shower which shoots out over the bath and onto the floor, a bed which you feel needs to be checked for cockroaches, or feel like your in a women's refuge then don't stay here. Perhaps I have been too spoilt in my hotel stays but this is my worst experience ever....and for the price of the accomodation I would expect to get this in a hotel that costs $30 for the night. I know it's New York and accomodation is expensive but obviously this is why they charge what they do and get away with it. Will never forget this place, for all the wrong reasons. The only positive was the location.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: gjm2783
Reviews.Content: Arrived late, check in was simple enough although they first put us on the 8th floor with a double bed - not ideal for 2 best pals sharing a room. Went back down and they changed us to a bunked bed room. Meant we lost the fridge that was in the other room but no big deal. Floor 11 room was directly opposite the toilet which has a key and a double lock on the inside. For having to share a bathroom this was perfect. it was literally 3 steps to the toilet. plus you could gauge if other were in it. the room was small, hot and had chewing gum on the wall. a sink with a mirror cabinet over it, a big walk in closet with ironing board, big bunk beds that were comfy and a nightstand with a phone that kept ringing (we just took it off th hook).power outlets, a big set of drawers with tv on top with good range of channels. It's basic and clean enough except for the chewing gum. certainly no bed bugs. dont go expecting the ritz. but we were there to sleep and change. we went out early morning around 8 and came in to change and back out till 4. thats what new york should be and for the price and location, you cant go wrong with this hotel. 28th street has its own subway stop a 2 minute walk from the door. there is also a cool deli on the corner that sells beer till 4am. it was really quiet and safe. security on the door at all times and the elevators were totally fine and fast. shared toilet was massive. clean and quiet. I never saw anyone else go in or come out and nobody needed in when i was in. Compare the price to somewhere a few streets higher and you will see the latham is the perfect choice for a cheap new york hotel. Id stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Latham Hotel, NY”
Reviews.Author: SarahBristol
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in New York (29th Oct 2011) and stayed at the Latham Hotel. Thought I should add the pros / cons of this place for people to make their own mind up: Pros: 1. Cheap accomodation for New York. 2. Desk staff helpful. 3. Elevator fine. 4. Location ok. Cons: 1. Rooms are run down and need a good lick of paint and proper clean. 2. Shared bathroom clean but access was sometimes difficult, with couples going in two at a time (we will not do a shared bathroom again). 3. Screaming children and shouting parents I do not want to hear. The place should either be a hostel/hotel or a placment for social services, the two do not mix really. Or maybe we were unlucky and had the floor with all the children/mothers (floor 6). 4. It is not a hotel but more of a Hostel type accomodation. 5. Take your own sheets / blankets if you want them nice and clean. 6. TV did not always work. 7. Rooms small. 8. Take airfreshner. I have stayed in New York several times and this hotel I will not be returning to. Hope this is useful. Feel free to contact me for further info if you wish

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Smith84
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 1 week stay at the Latham hotel. This hotel aint the prettiest in town but for price and location you cant ask for much more. We were situated on the 9th floor and after reading reviews about how poor the elevators were, i was a bit dubious. No need though as both elevators were in fine working order and me and my girlfriend had no problems. We paid for a room with shared bathroom. This wasn't a problem as I first thought it would be. The bathroom was free for us every morning and most times at night. I think we had to wait once. The bathroom was clean with a good shower and served its purpose. For the extra money it costs to have a private bathroom I wouldn't bother. Keep your money and spend it in the city. This hotel was for sleeping, not to prance about in a private bathroom. One thing I would say though is that the rooms should at least have a toilet if they don't have a shower/bath etc. Just a little inconvenient popping across the hall in the middle of night for a pee. But hey, what can ya do?? Room was cleaned everyday with fresh towels and had a TV with 30+ channels. It was very small but it had a bed, clean sheets everyday and it was safe in an excellent location. Thats what we got. On East 28th street you have subways either side only 2 blocks either way. From here its easy to get anywhere and if you like times square which we did then your just 2 stops away. We used the yellow line R train uptown and get off on 42nd street. This literally takes 5 minutes. Its also about a 20 minute walk as well if you like to stroll. Also turn right coming out of the hotel and on the corner you see the empire state building. This again is on your doorstep and just a few blocks away. Also Macy's on 34th street (1 subway stop) or short walk, Flatiron building also round the corner, Broadway, 5th avenue etc. All this is in the heart of Manhattan and this hotel is a perfect base to explore everything from. If you want no thrills, perfect safe location and reasonably priced accommodation then this is the place for you. Save your money for spending in the city and less time in the hotel. Thats why we visited New York, to be amongst it, not hidden away in an overpriced hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Doug Y
Reviews.Content: Just returned from NYC. Had a room with a bathroom on a lower level at the Latham. It was better than I expected. The room and bathroom were small but clean and I got fresh towels each day. I took a quick look for bugs and mice but saw none during my stay. Both elevators were in operation when I was there. And overall it was a good sleeping room and I think paying a bit more for a bathroom was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “If you really have to....”
Reviews.Author: SeekingForExcellence
Reviews.Content: myself (a girl) & 3 boys stayed there last week. I am going to be objective about this. room was VERY small - i mean 2 by 2 and that's it. you walk in there is a bed, a sink, closet with pipes sticking out in the air - so technically you cant store large luggage in there and a tv on top of a chest of drawers. watch out for the elevators - we stayed on the 12th floor - 2 nights that we stayed there the lift broke down 3 times. it is not the type of thing you want to see coming back drunk at 5am, and having to walk up 12 floors. there is no bathroom in the room - you have to share bathroom with the entire floor - one tip - bring flip flops. we called front desk for a rollaway - it was very quickly delivered to our room - and the gentleman was lovely! i actually feel sorry for him having to work there - the rollaway was not made & we were given a plastic bag full of sheets and having to make it ourselves. by the look of the room we slept in sweats and jumpers - just in case. staff at front desk speak in their own language around guests which i think is very unprofessional. we had a query about something and (apparently) we walked up to the wrong desk because a woman said she has nothing to do with the hotel and she directed us to the other desk (if you have nothing to do with the hotel, then what are you doing there?!!) room itself was OK. i mean nothing special, and i think the only reason they are getting away with the way rooms are is because its new york and people dont care because most of the time people only sleep there.....just to let you know we put privacy sign on the door because we did not know what to expect from stayover service - no offence to any housekeeper working there - believe me i do know how bad it is to be a housekeeper and how un-appreciated you are. lady at front desk (the proper front desk) was very nice & printed out directions to the places we needed. location is great, just one street down from empire state building. price wise, not too bad for new york - because i stayed in more expensive hotels - but for what they have to offer i have no idea how they could have charged us $150 a night! (down from $200!!!). Basically, if you only travel with one other person there will be enough room and make sure to ask for room on a lower level in case the lift breaks down again. (and one was already out of order when we arrived). location wise you are in the heart of everything pretty much.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: iflyanywhere
Reviews.Content: Even in a budget hotel, some things are not optional. Take for example a security lock on the door, a shelf in the bathroom, adequate light to read. You won't find these at the Latham. It is a run down but clean hotel that is partially residential, catering to low income single mothers from the looks of the traffic. The room is bare bones, linoleum flooring, modest furniture, no frills. The phone didn't work. we didn't try the TV because so few electrical outlets worked that we unplugged the tv to have a place to charge our electronics. there was one dim overhead light and one dim nightlight (plugged into an outlet that only worked sporadically) in a room for 4 people. We arrived late at night, with a confirmed reservation for a quad room. They didn't have one. they only had a room for two people. They offered us a free extra room for one person, but i was travelling with teens and I wasn't comfortable having one or both of them alone. So they brought us a cot, which was adequate, and ended up refunding me $40, which was more than the difference in cost between a 2 and 4 person room. There were 2 elevators, one for residential tenants and one for hotel guests. But for more than 1 day of our 4 day stay, the residential elevator was broken, making for slow, crowded conditions on the one remaining elevator. Given that the building is 12 stories, stairs are not a great alternative. The shower in the first room had really poor water pressure. It was better in the second room, but water was warm only, not hot. On the positive side, the location is great, very central and convenient in a decent neighborhood with subway stops one block away each direction, a starbucks within a block, and a great market with tons of prepared food, smoothies, coffee, pastires, right on the corner. Desk staff was helpful. For the price, it was definitely liveable, but I don't recommend it for anyone looking for any creature comforts or amenities, or anyone who plans to do more than sleep in their room.

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: nFatrin
Reviews.Content: i have been here last weekend for about 3 days 2 night me and friend had a small room.. but for me it was fine as long as no bugs and generally looking clean. the toilet was fine and good basically it was just a fine hotel not so comfortable because of the phone in the room kept ringing and i just put off the phone cover so that it wont ring and the bed is kind of noise and shaking but it was fine after all one of the staff , i dont know his name but he is one of the guy there he is so kind and helpful !!!!

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: TrampLegs
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on our first ever vacation together. It's extremely basic, but does exactly what you need it to. We were there to sleep and that's it. Afterall, you're in New York City for god sake!! How can anyone complain about that? The bathroom was always extremely clean and tidy. Although I'm not a fan of the 'shared bathroom', it turned out to be fine... Overall this hotel is fine. The holiday was fantastic and the hotel didn't add or take away from it one bit. There are single mum's living there, but really... who cares?! It is what it is!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and decadent”
Reviews.Author: Pereira01
Reviews.Content: First thing you should know is that this hotel is also a pension, people live there, specially single moms - they have a day care for children there too. I actually saw more residents than tourists during my 5 days. By that time (June 2011) just one elevator was in operation and they had this announcement next to the door saying that your waiting time for the elevator could be up to one hour. And they were not kidding, it was that slow. I always bumped into a bags of garbage, in the elevator or by my room door. Thats why the hole hotel stinks. Room (i had one with bathroom) is very very small. They gave me one with two single beds and when i asked for a double bed the woman in reception simply said "well, just put it together!". Guess they dont have double beds at all. Location is fine, but i´ll definetly pay a little more to stay in a slightly more confortable hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: holidaylinUk
Reviews.Content: i went with a group of friends to new york for the easter bank holiday, we just wanted a cheap room to stay in that was close to all attractions! This hotel suited us perfectly, it is very close to the empire state building and about a 20 min walk from times square! we paid a very low price fro this hotel in comparrison to other hotels in new york so i wasnt expecting to much but it was actually a suprise! we had bunkbeds in out room which were compfy, i slept fine! the bathroom was also better than expected! the lifts in the hotel take a long time which is a little annoying but overall it was a lot better than i thought it would be! If you are looking for cheap accomadation in a great loccation then go for this hotel! you dont go to new york to stay in your room all day anyways!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable beds and friendly staff - for trevellers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: mattcallis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location for sightseeing, just around the corner from Empire State and a subway station in the same street. The front desk staff are very friendly, there are a few mothers with children staying but are no problem at all, this is a budget priced hotel , the rooms are for sleeping only which is why we were there, as the days are spent out in the streets, the lift is slow but if u can deal with a few minutes wait no problem.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTED, GUTTED”
Reviews.Author: gemylou
Reviews.Content: What can i say?? This COULD have ruined mine and my boyfriends trip to New York, luckily it didnt. This was a birthday and christmas present. When we entered the hotel it wasnt a wow factor but for what i paid i wasnt expecting that anyway. When we was checking in we were told the hotel had suffered with a bad leak and that we had to move from our double room which we paid for to a room with BUNK BEDS, 2 lots of bunk beds at that! I was appauled, do you treat your guests like this? Walked into the room, and just burst into tears. I told the hotelier this was unacceptable and he did absolultely nothing to help us. I rang the travel agent back in England who i had booked the holiday with to try and sort it but obviously with a 5 hour time difference it was closed. I finally manage to speak to my agent the next day and he did his very best to help us but as it was NYE and the shop was closing this was very hard and time consuming! We had no joy and was stuck in this hell hole!! There was a massive shower leak in the night, maintanance did nothing and we had to clean it up ourselfs. It was horrific. We asked the manager to call us as she was never there. She never called. The location was FANTASTIC! 2 mins walk to empire state building. I STRONLY advise couples not to stay here, It could destroy your holiday. If your traveling then this would be brill,

Reviews.Title: “Fine, if you are just sleeping there and out most of the time”
Reviews.Author: Ben1982Manchester
Reviews.Content: The hotel was the cheapest we could find on Manhattan with reasonable reviews. It was clean and the staff were fine. The location was amazing and we could easily walk everywhere we wanted to go. Families waiting to be rehoused do stay here, but are no trouble at all. I wouldn't recommend the shared bathroom - it was perfectly clean but the toilet was blocked a couple of times. The lift is very slow and the radiator in the room was very noisy on our first night. The rooms are also very basic and in need of updating. There's a standard deli opposite and a posher one on the corner. We literally only slept in the room, we stayed out most of the day and well into the wee small hours, so the hotel meets our needs. Fine if you want to go budget and can put up with very basic room for incredible location.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE. Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: ElisBrunillo
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the 26th as booked, but they had no bedroom with a bath (like we booked), gave us a room without a bathroom, and with bed bugs (LOT's). We changed room twice, but still there was bugs and no bathroom. We canceled all our other nights, booked another hotel and they offered the night (just some hours) we stayed there and said there were no charges applied.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: lornalorna51
Reviews.Content: It was old and needed a total overhaul the bathroom was appauling everything was falling to bits, the paintwork in the room was all chipped and dirty. The bed was like sleeping on a plank, the heating was noisy there was a hole in the window next to the air conditioning that blew a gale through bearing in mind we are talking December. The only good thing I can say about the Latham is the location and the staff were friendly. It gave the impression when you walked in reception that you were at a hostel or the YMCA.

Reviews.Title: “WTF”
Reviews.Author: cruz403_10
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor & move onto the next property This place is the most ghetto, disgusting, gross, over priced, scary, fire hazard that I have ever seen. Can't even believe that the would still be in business. & all the single young mom's in the building....WTF!!! STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOLE

Reviews.Title: “Hell hole on 28th”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan85
Reviews.Content: Where to start? We looked for a cheap hotel (i use the word sarcastically) in and around the empire state building area and this place seemed to meet our budget and location expectations. Let me start by saying this is not a hotel. It is mostly a housing unit for single disadvantaged women who have children below the age of 3-4 years of age. The noise of screaming and crying kids at 4am in the morning is not what i expect of a hotel and nor should anyone looking to stay here. Now that's the good part because once you walk into one of the rooms in the latham it's like being transported back into another world. The room was disgusting with hair,sand and an unspeakable odour dominating the bathroom and shower. The room was small with hardly any daylight and the radiator was turned on two of the four nights we stayed making the room very stuffy and warm. it wqas impossible to turn the radiator off also. The room was advertised as a "double" but the bed itself would have had trouble fitting in two dwarfs. This combined with the fact the bed itself was broken lead to four nights of hellish sleeping. For the record it's room 1209 do NOT book this room. The sheets where not changed once in the four nights we stayed but the towels where changed daily. The staff where a disgrace with little or no help during our stay as well as a general ignorance towards tourists. When we went to collect our bags we where told to "to get them our self" from the baggage hold in the lobby. The one and only positive about the hotel is the location but for my wife and i this is'nt any kind of reason to recommend this hotel to anyone. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sandie1947
Reviews.Content: I knew that my daughter and I would be sharing a bathroom; that I could live with. What we didn't know is that half of the hotel is Section 8 housing! The room we stayed in was horrible. The first thing we did was threw the bedspread off the bed...only to find the underside stained and dirty. The sheet were so thin that you would see the blue pattern of the mattress. No mattress pad at all. The woodwork was chipped and in dire need of paint. The overhead light was a circular fluorescent bulb. The carpeting is old and worn. When we asked the desk clerk the status of bed bugs (in the meantime my daughter Yelped the hotel), he claimed he knew nothing about bed bugs in New York City. Really? Then he started blabbing about the State of Arizona and cockroaches. Great! I am not a high maintenance individual, but I do want a clean, welcoming room when I stay at a hotel. This room was not cheap (although not expensive either); we paid $164.00. We would have been better off spending the night at Port Authority!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, no fuss, clean”
Reviews.Author: Gerimac_10
Reviews.Content: My mum and I have just come back from 4 nights at the Lathan Hotel. We were expecting the worst, but we really wanted to stay close to everything and our budget did not allow us to stay in a better place. We were very nicely surprised. We found the hotel(more like a hostel really) just perfect for our needs,. The staff were so so so friendly and helpful. Room was basic(tv, bed cupboard, drawers, table) but spotless as was the bathroon. It was cleaned every day. Bed was small but very comfy. requested extra pillows and they were on our bed when we got back, requested hairdryer and it was brought up to the room within 5 mins. As for the LOCATION, it was AMAZING. We were so close to everyhing, we bought day subway tickets but ended up being so close to home most of the time that we would just walk. No food in the hotel but 24 hour FAB cafe/diner/take away/ grocery shop AND off license is 2 doors away. Yes there are kids in the place but they don't bother you in your room and you are not in the place for any other activities anyway. My favourite thing about this hotel was defo the location and least favourite was the small bed. Oh the only bad thing was the day we were leaving the guy at reception asked did we want a car and we said yes(not thinking). A black illegal cab arrived, the reception guy said it would be $60 all inc, the driver said $60 plus tip and toll. We argued with the driver and the doorman came out and cont to argue with him. We took a yellow cab instead to JFK airport and it was $45 flat including tolls ,excluding tip.Don't use the car service from the hotel!! The hotel take commission and the driver we met was a bit dodgy looking.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: TaTen
Reviews.Content: my mom and chose this hotel because we wanted a budget room with a private bathroom and a good location. when we arrived we were told that our room was not ready. Not wanting to wast time as were only in new york for two nights, we left our luggage and went exploring. when we returned that evening we were told that there were no rooms for us. we booked and paid over a month before our arrival date. the manager was extremly rude to us and told us that they would give us a room with a shared bathroom, whch we were happy to accept provided we got a discount. seen as we had paid for a better room. however this was not an option, we could either take the room or find another hotel in New York. Her attitude was unacceptable, rude and unprofesional and we spent the whole eveing tryng to find a room in New York, which wasted more time and money.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: gcgarcez
Reviews.Content: Many people live in this building. Many children. A lot of noise early at morning. The social elevator was not working. The service elevator was terrible. It tooks a lot of time (sometimes tooks 10 minutes to reach). Some staff were rude and unpolite (some others no). The room is small and dark. The only thing I liked was that the hotel was near the subway (green line and broadway line).

Reviews.Title: “Fine!”
Reviews.Author: Ellaxx
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in The Latham Hotel for 4 nights. We booked a double room with a private bathroom (recommended). Rooms are basic but are cleaned everyday with new sheets and towels provided also. The hotel is in a GREAT location, literally 2mins from Empire State Building and all the 34th Street shopping! Staff were very helpful and did what they could for us. The elevator is old and there is only 1 working, however, we were on the 12th floor and only had to take the stairs once! You just have to be patient with it! It will come! Subways are on the same street and lead to uptown and downtown New York so everything is so accessible from the hotel. From reading other reviews on this site, I must admit, I was a little nervous arriving at the hotel, especially since it was my first time in New York. But all i can say is that from my experience, the Latham Hotel was FINE. We got our moneys worth....and whatever money you save from booking this hotel, can be used on shopping!!! Thanks, Elaine & John - Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service but good location”
Reviews.Author: Clairew79
Reviews.Content: When I tried to check in the guy behind the counter was on his mobile for 10 minutes to a mate laughing and joking and ignored me. He then answered a call from a hotel room and proceeded to shout at them about something. I was meant to be a single room but had a room with 2 bunk beds in which was extremely cramped even if I did have it to myself. The rooms were clean and the hotel was in a good location. One of the lifts as not working which led to long delays waiting for the old lift to arrive - if at all.

Reviews.Title: “Recomended”
Reviews.Author: mjrcastro
Reviews.Content: I stayed last week (September 2010) in Latham Hotel and I really recomend it. It is very central, clean and the workers were very helful. Of course it is not a five star hotel but you are not paying a five star hotel. It was the first time I shared a bathroom and I was reaaly worried but it was always clean, available and was in front of my room´s door. The hotel is 3 minutes walk from Empire State Building, 1 minute of 5 th avenue and has almost all transports in a short walk distance. The lift was a bit slow but it didn´t bring any inconvience. Thanks Sean and candida. Maria Castro from Portugal.

Reviews.Title: “Simple”
Reviews.Author: fi12fi
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, about 20 minute walk from Times Square, and 2 minutes from EmpireState and Macy's. Generally rooms and bathrooms were clean, did have a jail like feel when i first walked in, but beds were comfortable and you have a sink in your room, was a nice surprised to see a big TV with good channels in the room! Wasnt a real problem with having a shared bath apart from in the mornings when everyone needed the loo! Also Lift is unreliable one of them broke down when we were there could be a problem if your on top floor :S But for what you are paying for you have excellent location with basic accomidation, and the staff were also friendly and happy to help and advise you, and help with discounts on attractions within New York. A good place to stay if your on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: JMolloy99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here November 08 and enjoyed it thoroughly.Planning on making it my base for a 2012 trip as well. Room was cleaned daily, staff at reception I found helpful with arranging my transfer to the airport and also in givin directions to some of the places I was going. Room tended to get incredibly warm in the middle of the night which was a slight irritation but New York was having a major cold snap so it was appreciated on some of the days. No problems with noise.Used the shared bath and was either lucky or using good timing as it was always available when I needed it. There did always seem to be a queue for the elevator whiich I didn't use until my very last day there (bag had swelled with shopping).Overall no major complaints about the Hotel. The halfway house element wasn't really an issue for me aside from the elevator queues

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: sacafleurs
Reviews.Content: We knew the cost of accomodation in NYC was incredible and for that amount of money, the hotel was alright. We had a room with a shared bathroom and unfortunately, we heard everyone coming and going in the choridor 'very nice at 2AM...). Appearently some families live in this hotel as we could see mums and their kids going to school every morning. It is a good value for money for NY I guess but I would not go back there should I ever come back to the city. The pictures give you a pretty good idea of what you can expect. On the other hand the man at the reception was very nice and helped us with anything we needed!

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: travell82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here back in Feb and after returning home from some travelling noticed some of the other comments and though i would support. The hotel was not overly great though the room was big enough for one..... I can see the halfway house situation. Reception advised to be careful if coming in and out late at night. The hotels location was fantastic but the rooms are in seriouos need of a paint job and new furniture. The clealiness of the room left alot to be desired it was terrible i had to ask for a new shower curtain as the one i had was molded and torn the water went everywhere. I would not stay here again. I moved to a different hotel after 2 nights i could not stay there any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: travelerkurt1980
Reviews.Content: Bed bugs, mites and even dirty sheets. (hair on sheets and what looked like multiple stains on sheets too, possibly blood...not joking here.) I knew I wasn't getting a four star hotel because of the price, but the fact that this hotel is charging anyone any amount to stay here is appalling. Asking the staff questions resulted in them mumbling to me in jumbled sentences. At night I heard people yelling in the hallways, and the elevator never came and had to use the stairs. I never write these things, but how this hotel continues to stay in business boggles my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Has the basics... and saves you money... Decent location”
Reviews.Author: natureguy33
Reviews.Content: Well I was not expecting a whole lot from this hotel but the service was pretty good.. They actually change your sheets everyday . There were some problems with the shared bath ... our shared bathroom had no knob to ajust the shower ... but there was a bolt there to turn it... The door knob fell off the door to the bathroom, but you could still open the door from the lock on the inside of the door. The toilet backed up... but they fixed it after being told about it. The room had a carpet but was a little sticky... I recomend wearing flip flops on the floor in the room and in the shower... The air conditioner work well.. kept the room real cool. There was a small refrigerator in the room that work real well... There were other people living in the building, but I believe they had their own bathrooms.. Mostly saw unwed mothers with there babies living there... Guess they help pay the mortagage for the building. So overall it was a decent place to crash, but I would not want to spend a whole day in my room...

Reviews.Title: “The only time I have moved hotels in the middle of the night.”
Reviews.Author: ChiroKid
Reviews.Content: I was COMPLETELY unsatisfied with this hotel. First, I was uncomfortable finding out that not only is it a hotel but, it is a residential building - even though there was a security guard in the lobby I did not feel safe knowing this. I also felt uncomfortable from the very beginning in my ride up the elevator to my 12th floor room and became even more hesitant walking down the hallway to my room. I felt like I was in a very unfortunate scene straight out of CSI NY. The hallway wasn't well lit and I heard loud televisions and crying babies ( this is not an exaggeration.) Anyway, I got into the room not expecting much at all and knowing that I wouldn't have a bathroom to myself. To make this short, here are the major CONS that made me leave the hotel and check in elsewhere (the American Dreams Hostel which was fabulous for taking me in after midnight and having breakfast in the morning. VERY clean, extremely inexpensive, and in the process of being completely remodeled): - I pulled back the cover on one of the two beds in the very cramped room and the sheets on the bed were so thin that you could see the pattern of the cheap mattress straight through the material. - I couldn't last a full hour in the room because when I sat on the bed or stood on the carpet with shoes on my bare skin was being bitten, relentlessly, by bugs that I'm assuming were bed bugs (I was told rudely by the man at the front desk the next day that they definitely were not bed bugs because I would have been able to see them. Looking them up now, I find that yes, there are bed bugs that are microscopic) or some type of mites or fleas. - This may not mean much to some people but, I just felt unsafe (I am a female, solo traveler) and I had a gut feeling that I needed to leave... The bugs were actually enough for me to leave though. Anyway, I didn't get my money back after speaking to the man at the front desk about the problems with the room. The man also acted extremely non-empathetic concerning my situation. He obviously didn't take pride in his job or the establishment because if he did, he would have worked to make me happy (considering I didn't even stay the night in the room) and he wouldn't have bickered with me whether the bugs in the room were bed bugs or not when I told him that the room seriously needed to be fumigated. The pictures on the Latham Hotel's website make it look like the Ritz Carlton compared to what it actually looks like. I am not a hotel snob but I do appreciate cleanliness, bug-free rooms, and nice employees. If these are also things you are looking for in a hotel, DO NOT stay at this poor excuse for "A Hotel with Hostel Prices." I would much rather stay at a hostel (I ended up having to) in exchange for a good nights' rest.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: nycshoegal
Reviews.Content: Had I know the rudeness of the staff and the quality of the rooms, I would have never stayed at this hotel. I reserved the PENTHOUSE and recieved a shabby room that was noisy and run down. Yes, I did have my own bathroom but other than that, worthless. The staff including the manager was rude and crude and just deplorable. I had a reservation for late checkin of which I called and spoke with the manager personally yet upon check in, my room was not available and listed as no show!! Called manager on it and he denied speaking to me, yet I wrote down his name when I talked to him. I travel to NYC 3-4x's per year and this beat all in terms of slum hotel. And dont forget the unwed mothers that live there and are rude to you!! Like its your fault they are down and out. I work for my living!!

Reviews.Title: “Totally decent”
Reviews.Author: msperstravel
Reviews.Content: Overall the Latham is a great budget hotel. It is very clean and seemed safe, which are the most important things when booking a budget hotel. The front desk staff are really nice and helpful, especially JP - he is like a concierge you expect to find at an expensive hotel. You are very close to everything either by walking or subway and if you like Indian food you are in luck because you are right next to little India. All of the restaurants and bars in the area are very affordable because you are off the main tourist track by a little bit, which is really nice for budget travelers. The room was a nice size and you have a sink in your room. The bathroom is spacious and clean. The first two nights we had no problem getting into the bathroom when we needed to, the last evening and morning the hotel was busier and there was a wait, which is sort of annoying because there is only one bathroom per floor and it has both the shower and toilette and you cannot use bathrooms on other floors. The bed is not super comfortable, but I might be biased as we normally sleep in a very firm queen size bed. If you don't mind "springy" and small, it will be fine. The only other problem was that the air conditioner was pretty loud because it rattled the window when the compressor came on, we remedied this by turning it all the way up so it ran continuously and the loud white noise was constant. We didn't sleep well, but hey, we didn't come to New York for a restful weekend get away. Overall, a totally decent hotel at a very cheap rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic, but Affordable, Clean and in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: VaRoxy
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel before booking and went in having no expectations other than that it was very centrally located and was considered clean. My expectations were met. The hotel is in a very good location - central to everything including Madison Square Garden and the Theater District (I attended events at both places). The room was rather rundown, but it was clean and we were not in there very much at all. We actually cracked up laughing as we entered the room because it was tiny and we had a view of a brick wall! However, it is NYC and the room was very affordable when compared with other options. We had a private bathroom, which was also clean. I really can't complain at all other than to say the bed was uncomfortable; however, we were so tired, it really didn't matter. I was a little curious about reviews that said this hotel housed single mothers and their children. I don't know if I would have even noticed had I not read it in the reviews. I wouldn't let this discourage anyone. I would definitely recommed the hotel to anyone staying for a long weekend. It may have gotten a little uncomfortable for a longer stay. Oh, there is Cafe 28 just a few steps away from this hotel and it was the perfect place for breakfast, midnight snacks and just about anything else you might need (open 24 hours).

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: stonielad
Reviews.Content: second time ive stayed here... was here for 10 days altogether with my girlfriend..... if you want to be in your hotel all the time then go stay at the plaza.. if you want a cheap clean friendly safe base to stay as you wander the amazing streets of New York then this is for you.... Looks a bit shaby, but its great.... the staff are brilliant especially the indian / mexican man who remembered my room number nad was always polite... the rest of the staff we saw rarely as we were never there but when we did see them they were great and always friendly..... Location is amazing just a few blocks from metro and empire state building... the deli on the corner is amazing but so is the deli opposite, the taco bell on the corner and the numerous other food and coffee places nearby... no noise in the hotel, great cleaning service and great hotel... definately stay here and recommend it again....

Reviews.Title: “Really good place to stay, best location!”
Reviews.Author: Tony-and-Ge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably really old, but clean and we had a quiet floor! we had shared bathroom: they were cleaned many times a day, always perfectly clean! the room was small but quiet, we had tv, A.C, telephone. the staff wasn't really smily but who cares? the location was perfect! halfway between the Empire State Building and the FlatIron Bldg! we spend 10 days in this hotel and we will definitely go back next time!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: TomTom1986
Reviews.Content: I first went to NYC in 2007 and stayed in the Grand Hyatt, granted this is a much nicer hotel than the latham but the only time you should spend in a htel in NYC is the time you wish to sleep. I can't understand people writing reviews on here expecting the world when paying peanutts?! value for money was A* and the man we dealt with in reception went out of his way to help us anyway he could. The room was hot during the nights so we just opened the window, the communal shower room was spotless each morning and afternoon on our return. i'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget and realistic on what they should expect! if you don't like the hotel then it's the perfect excuse to spend more time out in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: boogaloolondon
Reviews.Content: my partner and i have just returned from new york, we stayed at the latham and found it be a great little hotel, the staff really do go the extra mile for you and are very friendly and helpful, it was our first time staying here and we would definately stay there again. the hotel boasts a fantanstic location, near many of the local sites and attractions also near for the subway and other connections, we could not fault this hotel and its staff and would like to say thanks for looking after us guys!! so please travellers if you are looking for a great budget hotel in the middle of manhattan...... then the latham is the one. michelle and lloyd from london, uk.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - but would not recommend Latham Hotel”
Reviews.Author: telgirl2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Latham for 3 nights in January 2010. We were a school group of 44 pupils and 7 staff. On arrival we had a nightmare trying to sort out our rooms, we had been told before travelling to split our kids into rooms of 4, on arrival we discovered there were no rooms of 4, or at least not enough, so we only had rooms for 3, and not enough rooms to go around. I had stressed to our tour company we MUST have staff rooms on the same floor as the pupils to allow us to supervise them properly. I made it clear we would split across more than one floor if absolutely necessary but again must have staff rooms on each floor. On check in the Latham were trying to spread our pupils into rooms across 9 floors - last time i did any maths 7 into 9 just dosen't go. Hotel blamed tour company, tour company blamed hotel, each said the other didnt tell them etc etc. In the end after an awful lot of haggling and heated phone calls with the general manager who wasnt there at the time we just about made everyone fit. 2 of our lads did end up sleeping on the floor of one room though! We then discovered that 1 room had no heating at all and the member of staff in it was freezing for the whole time we were there. Other rooms had heating that would not switch off and was like a furnace.] At about 3am one morning 2 of the lads heard a bang and discovered a big bubble in their ceiling, which then burst and leaked water down on them,. Had to do a rapid room change! Just as well they heard it and woke up or could have been much worse. Turned out to be a burst pipe which knocked out the hot water for a while to the whole hotel. The rooms are not very big, and are quite grubby, not the most comfortable beds either. The hotel is used for social housing, we were aware of that and it didnt cause us any problems apart from a noise issue one night. It is in a good location for places like ESB which is literally 5 minutes away and the nearest subway isnt far. I wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a money!”
Reviews.Author: Pertsa81
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value for a money. I stay here in 7 night and this was excellent choice when you want low budget accomodations. I has single room with shared bathroom, there was also a tv in a room what was nice bonus. It was easy watch weather and some news. Building is old and rooms are not renovated but room was still clean. Window views was not the best one, there was wall about half meter from window so natural light not come inside a room. Bed was comfortable and housekeeping made bed every day and change towels. Shared bathroom was nice and also clean every time. One time closet going clog but problem was fastly fixed. Last eve i see one roach in my room but i think it this is normally in old buildings? Location was excellent, few minutes walking green and yellow lines metrostations, also timesquare and best restaurants and shopping areas are short walking. When i next time come New York, i surely come back this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: arosee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value and I got everything I would expect from it. The room was small but kept clean. I felt safe and it wasn't too noisy. The shared bathroom was clean and the shower was hot. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, but rooms are too hot to sleep well”
Reviews.Author: Food_Lover_Hamburg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for five nights, and unfortunately the rooms have a central heating system which becomes increadibly hot. It felt like 85F (30C) in our room, so that sleeping was very hard. On top, we did not have a window to cool the room, but an air condition which was super loud. If you plan on doing a lot during your stay in NYC, I would suggest to stay in another hotel so you will get a good night sleep! On the plus side, the location is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: LCDaMan
Reviews.Content: OK, it isn't the Four Seasons, and the rooms are small. But it was a clean, secure, quiet place to stay, less than $100 a night, and the location is top-notch, five blocks from the Empire State Building. We had one of the rooms with bath, so can't comment about the common bathrooms. As noted elsewhere, there is a shelter for single mothers located on the bottom floors of this hotel, but we were on the 5th floor and didn't hear a thing from them or any street noise. The staff was very helpful, but then we're pretty low-maintenance and don't need much. Cafe 28 on the corner is good, also has an internet cafe with printer for boarding passes and such, and there's a Chinese restaurant next door to the hotel. Another good place for breakfast, a short walk away, is Eisenberg's Deli on 22nd and 5th. You'll come away full and happy for $5-6 each.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TNBreview
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Latham for approx. 12 days during last December month. In general I really liked staying here. A short overview: Like: - Friendly staff - Great Location (Closeby the Empire State Building, 5 minute walk from any subway) - Low cost stay - Clean shared bathroom (I chose for a shared bathroom since this was a lot cheaper, this was a good choice since it was kept clean very well) Dislike: - radiator in room makes strange noises every now and then I can recommend this hotel to anyone who wants something better/cleaner than a hostel and yet something affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat hotel for location & price"”
Reviews.Author: Gembo28
Reviews.Content: Myself and another female traveller stayed here for 7 days over New Year. The hotel is in a brilliant location - just around the corner from the Empire & Flatiron Buildings. Very close to multiple subway stations with very easy access to the rest of the city. The hotel itself is quite old but it can't be beaten for the price we paid. Less than £600 between two for 7 days over New Year. The room was very clean and was actually quite spacious. Yes its old, yes the water pipes crackle at odd hours in the night but it was cleaned everyday and was always smelling fresh when we returned each night. The location is perfect - we had no worries/ issues about walking to/ from the subway stations late at night. We walked back to the hotel from Times Square on New Years Eve and it took about 25 minutes. Subway stations located within a few minutes walk. Great deli across the road. People moan about the lift being slow and yes it is slow - you normally have to wait a few minutes for it to arrive at your floor but it really isn't that much of an inconvenience at all. We had a "shared" bathroom which was always very clean - hardly ever had to wait to use facilities which was good considering the hotel was fully booked. The bathroom was clearly recently renovated and was in great condition. The lock on the room door seemed a bit cranky (because the doors are so old) so would recommend to keep valuables locked in case or ask for safety deposit at reception. The hotel does seem to be home to mothers with children but they keep to themselves and do not bother any guests. The hotel staff were approachable and pleasant. Upon check out a couple in front of us had incurred a phone bill of long distance charges which was quite high - as they claimed they did not know calling California would be long distance the manager halfed the bill. All staff we encountered speak good English. At the end of the day you do not go to NYC to spend your time in the hotel so for what you need (somewhere comfy and clean to sleep and shower) this hotel is great. We were a bit weary before visiting the hotel because of the reviews on here but we were very impressed and hope to stay at the Latham during our next visit to NYC. All in all we would definately recommend The Latham. Yes its old, yes its cranky, but is is also clean, brilliantly located, cheap and cheerful. 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel but fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: DoubleDSpain
Reviews.Content: Okay it's very basic but can't be beaten for location right off 5th Ave and round the corner from Empire State Building. I would advise a room with en suite bathroom however. If you just need a place to sleep then this is fine. The rooms may be shoddy but ours was very clean, the bedding and bathroom couldn't be bettered. I found the staff very helpful and pleasant and couldn't be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Describe How Bad This Hotel Is!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jockybscotland
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I have ever written but I feel that I need to warn people about this hotel and how bad it is. I am quite well travelled and without doubt this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in by far. A few words that don't even come close to fully describring how bad this hotel/care hostel is - run down, dirty, black, cr*p hole, unsafe, flea ridded to be honest you get the idea - truely aweful. People who are rating this hotel greater than terrible are having a laugh. It is more of a hostel / safe house for single mothers. The man on reception couldn't even speak English he could barely read. Dont get caught out by the website, it looks ok on the website but it is so far removed from reality. Do yourself a favour and stay away - stay well away!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mensan
Reviews.Content: Okay the room we had is not very big, but the location is perfect for a touristic city trip. Our room was on 12th floor, with king size bed and private bathroom. All was good and very clean. Room is warm, window could not be openend. Airconditioning was working good, but is noisy. Elevator is slow but never let us down during 7 days of our stay. Hotel also has mothers and children living in; never heard any noise. Staff is very pleasant. Just around the corner perfect breakfast spot: Cafe 28!

Reviews.Title: “Honest review”
Reviews.Author: ivefra
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the place! It looked nice and clean from outside, not bad in the lobby (old) but not bad, when you go to the room, that was the scary part, they have actually put 2 sets of bunkbeds in the room, mind you the room is about 100 SQ ft tiny . Me and my friend could'nt walk or sit to have a conversation. No good i would rather spend 20 to 40 dollars more and stay in a better hotel, they should not allow having those rooms like that. I would recommend for everyone to find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: OttawaRose21
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in the Latham Hotel for four nights in early November. This is a basic hotel -- small rooms, no closet and, in our case, a shared bathroom. This hotel is clean, very well located, some areas seem to have been freshly painted and the bathroom had been recently redone. Perhaps those who have posted negative reviews are not aware of the overall hotel prices in NYC. If I had paid the same price (roughly $130 per night) at another location, I too would have been shocked at the bare-bones accommodation, but in NYC, this hotel is good value for money. Staff were pleasant and the room was nicely cleaned each day. I felt the hotel was very good value and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel of all time”
Reviews.Author: pvallely
Reviews.Content: When my friend booked the latham we were charged €450 each for 4 nites. this works out to be $600 dollars. what we got was just shocking. Rooms filthy, a horrid smell , it seems to me mnaybe a substitute for an insane asalum. on one of the mornings we were awoke to a man screaming for one hour.not good Location was great but found taht we were screwed over, how they got hotel status i dont know, If your considering a trip to new york if ya have any sense pay the extra dollars and stay elsewhere, anything else can be better than latham

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain; good location; clean, quiet, friendly; very basic but good value”
Reviews.Author: oldmusta
Reviews.Content: Negative reviews that we read had us wondering but being here we found those reviews dead wrong. At the Front Desk, we were greeted warmly and all interaction with staff has been the same. The lobby and our floor (8th) are very clean,freshly painted. Shared bathroomon our floor has clearly been recently renovated with beautiful dark geen ceramic tile (looks like slate) with modern fixtures, large roomy walk-in shower, and very clean. Surprised to find soap and shampoo (mini-bottles) provided and clean, fresh towels. Room is very basic and beds not full mattresses but more like a cot but in keeping with the price. We were so tired after seeing so much of this exciting city, sleeping has not been a problem. Great location as well. We are two women in our 60's and felt very safe everywhere we walked this evening including a 4 block walk from the bus back to the hotel. BTW the subway and buses have all felt very safe here. The 24-hour Bon Gout Deli is 2 blocks up on 5th Avenue from the hotel which is on 28th St E. If you are looking for a bargain hotel that is safe and clean, you can't beat the Latham Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but fine”
Reviews.Author: southcoastpete
Reviews.Content: Wasn't quite sure what to expect of the Latham when I arrived, but I have to say mostly it was fine. It is on the basic side, but then as others have said, your not in New York to stay in your hotel room. My room was simple, I used the toilet/bathroom down the corridor. But it was fine for sleeping. Location is great, with the Empire State Building not far away, a two subway stations nearby. I should add too that I found the area fine, even coming back at 3.30am! I would say if you want a good value place to stay, but don't want to share a dorm in a hostel, go for this place

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - don't listen to the whingers!”
Reviews.Author: SouthEastMelbGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, the net cafe/restaurant on the corner is the best I've ever been to, the staff are friendly and the rooms are immaculately clean. The bedding was not ridden with bugs, the sinks were not dirty and the communal bathrooms are clean. The beds are averagely comfy and not at all like you'd get in a hostel. Nice big tv, phone, airconditioner. Quiet, no noise at night. Great price. What others were expecting I'm not sure, but it's not like the Hilton because you're not paying for the Hilton. The elevator is extremely slow, but look on the bright side, you can get to know the other people in the elevator by the time it reaches the ground floor :P I have stayed in hundreds of cheap and expensive hotels and I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. DO NOT LISTEN TO THE WHINGING POMS, THEY COMPLAIN ABOUT EVERYTHING!

Reviews.Title: “HUMAN HAIR on bedsheets and pillows. WORST HOTEL EVER.”
Reviews.Author: oceansman
Reviews.Content: Here's the TRUTH...me and my wife spent 24 hours here... - The hallways STUNK and SMELLED of MOLD. - The "hotel" room was more like a "hostel". It was less than 100 sq feet - The room had TWO bunk beds with sheets that had HUMAN HAIR on them. - The pillows had HUMAN HAIR on them and were FILTHY. - We had to sleep on the beds on BATHROOM TOWELS, so we didn't get dirty from the bedsheets - The elevator was BROKEN the day we checked out - The bathroom had NO water pressure and barely got hot - The service was NON EXISTENT, nobody seemed to care that a married couple had to sleep separately on two separate bunk beds We have traveled around the country many times and stayed at many hotels, this was by far the worst experience EVER. It was more like a "youth hostel" than a hotel. A DIRTY "youth hostel".

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: sarasaras
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review quite late, but I remember my horrible experience staying at the Latham like it was yesterday. I've read many of the other reviews, and agree with everything the bad ones say - the heating was swelteringly hot, the tub was rusting, the bed was thin and lumpy. I do have one bad point to add, though - our bedspread had a massive bloodstain on the underside! We didn't see this until the morning we checked out, because it was on the side that touches the sheet. Completely disgusting. And I agree with others when I say that this hotel is definitely used to house people on welfare - that should be advertised in all descriptions. We had to share the elevator several times with mothers and children who were foul mouthed and rude. Shocking. The reason I only gave a 1 on value isn't because I thought it was too expensive, but because it was completely disgusting even for the £90/night we paid a year and a half ago.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, good value, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: shellie40
Reviews.Content: The Latham Hotel is advertised as a budget hotel and that is exactly what it is. If you book and expect more you will be disappointed but if you accept that you have paid a very small amount for a basic hotel in an excellent location, then you will be satisfied. The rooms are adequate, little worn in places and the decor isn't wonderful but the rooms are comfortable and clean. The showers arent very powerful but we managed. The rooms are cleaned daily and the bedding and towels are changed daily. The rooms are safe and airconditioned. The airconditioning is a little noisy but we were so tired when we returned each evening, we slept easily! Manager and staff at reception are really friendly and were happy to help us when we needed any advice. The hotel does house mums and their children and maybe this should be made more clear. However, the young mums were very quiet, polite and also helpful in my experience. The children were well behaved and a pleasure to talk to. It was great to be mixing with New Yorkers in the hotel! Obviously babies cry at times but i can honestly say i never heard them during the night. In other reviews people have commented on the elevator. Yes, it is a little slow.....what's the rush! Whenever we were seen waiting in the lobby, a member of staff took us to our floor in the staff elevator....we weren't left waiting. Lastly, the location.....absolutely great! Walked out of the hotel and turned left onto 5th Avenue with a view of the Empire State building. Fantastic deli on the corner with internet access as well as great food. The hotel is situated in a safe area. I loved New York and had a fantastic time! If staying at this good value hotel means my children and I can go again, then the Latham Hotel is where i will stay!

Reviews.Title: “What does everyone expect??”
Reviews.Author: JPKTMBA
Reviews.Content: I read and read and read, the reviews of this hotel before I booked, I really wanted to stay somewhere central for location and not spend a massive amount of money, we flew in about 2100 and rang the hotel to confirm everything, which was all fine (great start). After arriving to the hotel we went up the retro elevator and into the room the hallways are a little noisy from the young families in the building. The rooms however were really quiet, now dont get me wrong the hotel is old school, but the bathroom had just been renovated and was very clean and was always cleaned when we left. The deli on the cormer when you leave the hotel is fantastic and worth the dine everytime. The rooms are small but all we wanted was somewhere to rest are sleapy heads. I think this hotel was fantastic for the price and location, it is not a five star hotel but is not a dive as well, I think it all fits in with the aura of this fantastic city and if you are on a budget you cannot go wrong, but please dont expect the world as this hotel is not that. Go in with an open mind as what this hotel is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel - only stay for price”
Reviews.Author: ESG2009
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel when my husband and I booked a last minute trip to New York. It was very cheap and looked like a decent enough hotel on the website. I was quite unhappy with it in the end. The room was decent enough - but very old and down trodden. The hallways however smelled and looked like a hospital. The lift is very old and takes such a long time to come. I don't think the position is that good as some review say. Everything in New York is walking distance, but this hotel is not in the nicest area. That said, it comes down to price and if you are solely motivated by price - it's a cheap hotel. However, I do believe there are some good deals around at the moment and you can do much better. Even spending slightly more a night is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Right Fit For The Right Person”
Reviews.Author: ozzmodan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for: (1) sleep (2) personal hygiene (3) putting your stuff somewhere (4) saving money If you have any needs beyond those 4 things you'll probably be better served elsewhere. For my wife & I, the complete utilitarian nature of the Latham was ideal. The money that we didn't waste on a hotel we weren't going to see much of, we instead spent on things that matter. We did not have much interaction with the staff beyond simply checking in & out, but they seemed friendly & very quick. There was only one "issue" during our stay & they were quick to address it (later in review). There are obviously single mothers & their children who live &/or work there. The children were very well behaved & as far as I could tell stayed on seperate floors from the guests, they had no negative impact on the quality of our stay. Physicallly the hotel reminded me of staying in mid 50s era army barracks. The floors were 12"x12" tile & there seemed to be only 2 or 3 colors used in the vast majority of the hotel: white, off-white & national parks brown. The only departure from this decor was in the communal washroom, which obviously has been updated to inspire more confidence, with grey stone tile & newish looking dark tile walls. It comes equipped with one toilet, one shower stall with glass door, one upward opening window for ventilation, one sink with ledge & mirror above. To prevent someone from walking in the door has a slide latch. It also requires a seperate key that you get when you check in. Our actual room was approx 12' x 10' & was predictably white on white white. Walking in directly to the left in the corner is a pedestal sink. To the left & forward there was a end table with 19" CRT TV with a generic New York skyline print above. Along the far wall there was a dresser with phone on the left, radiator on the right & a window in the center with white vinyl blinds, curtains & an air conditioner. Behind the open door there is a medium-small bar & shelf style closet. Of course in the middle of all this there is a double bed with a generic budget hotel style print blanket & white cotton sheets. The bed itself was softer than I would have preferred but we came to bed tired every night & had no issues getting a good sleep. The radiator in our room worked exceedingly well, so much so that we actually used the fan on the air conditioner to pull air in from the outside to bring it back to a comfortable temperature (my wife & I like it cool).
