The bonus from this is that we got some nice white noise from the fan. If you require silence to sleep, this would probably be an issue. The in-room sink we found to be somewhat slow in draining, not so much though that it was unuseable. I did not use the TV & the phone, well it's a basic touch tone phone (there was a current phone book in the room.) Our room was across from the communal washroom so you could hear (not loudly) people when they entered/left the washroom. The noise level in general was very low when we had stayed, people seemed to be mindful to not make noise in the hallway & the doors filtered out approx 30-40 decibals. As much as the appearance would lead you to believe otherwise, this hotel is exceedingly clean. There is no bugs, no mold, no random hairs, no grime, it would even be fairly difficult to find any dirt. It would appear as if they clean the blankets & matresses on a very regular basis (which unfortunately seems pretty rare in the hotel industry). The only "non-clean" event I had was when I found the toilet in the communal washroom was clogged. The problem was fixed within 10 minutes. As with any communal washroom situation I recommend always wear sandels & keep all toiletries off public surfaces (maybe it's just the Howard Hughes in me.) The location of the hotel is great. It is a short walk either way to the subway lines which is the best way to go any significant distance. The 24 hr. cafe on the corner (Cafe 28) was great. It became a staple for breakfast before heading out for the day & a great place to pick up nearly any drink we could want before going back to our room for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Location makes up for everything!”
Reviews.Author: sinanissimo
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! It's between Madison and 5th! That's what makes this hotel so rare for their prices! Don't expect a Four Seasons, but it's not a "bed bug" hooker motel too. I'm a student from RI and I rarely come to NYC. I've stayed at very expensive hotels with my family as well, but, as a fellow college student, I need to be frugal. I was in in NYC for a night, so it worked out perfect for me! I booked a single shared-bathroom VIA calling them. It's SO much cheaper ($80/night)! I told them that they advertised the student discount and I wanted to use it as well! She didn't let me, HOWEVER, she made it up by upgrading me to a private bathroom room for free. I'm DEFINITELY coming back! And for those complainers, Jesus people!!, if you want luxury, work 40 more hrs a week and get a room at Mandarin Oriental! This hotel is perfect for its value and location!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, very central hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LDuck
Reviews.Content: We had read some dreadful reviews before visiting, but actually found the hotel to be good value. The room was quite clean, and the private bathroom was kept very clean. We felt the best part about the hotel was the location, which was very central for mid-town Manhatten (and next door to a great deli!). The worst part was probably that the freestanding bath rocked when taking a shower. The staff were helpful and friendly. All in all a good value place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “i loved the latham”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkSpencer
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on webpage , i felt a bit dubious about staying. On arrival reception were very helpful, when entering my room, I thought ok, what we got here then, a view of a brick wall, i wasnt bothered , I found it amuseing. I inspected the bedding and other parts of the room and was pleasently surprised. The bed was very comfortable, the sink was clean, the air con was working and cable tv was fully working. I soon grew to love it ! Shared showering room was excellent , always had hot water , one day I found a mess in the bathroom and reported it to staff and it was immediatly cleaned to my satisfaction. Lift was slow , which was expected as its a 12 floor hotel and there was only one lift in use. As for the single mothers and children who were also sharing the hotel, they were very polite and were no trouble what so ever. Fantastic location and fantastic deli (cafe 28} on the corner . LOVED IT !!!!!!!!! ILL BE BACK IN 2011 !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I came Back and will again and again........”
Reviews.Author: brotheroftheroad
Reviews.Content: This is my home away from HOME. i always wnted an apartment in the city or a time share and with todays economic futureI have found the dimond in the rough that we were looking for MGR STEPHEN DEFAZIO and STAFF CANDY at the front deskmade my wife and myself feel rightb at home with thier knowledge of the city save me hundreds of dollars shopping for my wifes cloths .. THEY WENT ABOVE AND BEYOND AnY OTHER HOTEL WE HAVE STAYED. all the while never forgeting our name and adressing us with the profesionalism that we would get at the 400 dollar anite rooms up the street.LOCATION AND PRICE WAS THE DECIDING FACTOR. FOR A 100 YEAR OLD BUILDING CUDOS TO ALL STAFF AND MGR... I WILL RETURN AGAIN AND AGAIN... LOVE THE NEIGHBORHOOD......

Reviews.Title: “Budget Price With First Class Location”
Reviews.Author: NeedPivo
Reviews.Content: It is not, nor will ever be, the Waldorf, Carlyle or the Ritz. Nor should it be confused with a Marriott Courtyard, Holiday Inn or any other cookie-cutter chain. What it is, though, is a low priced budget hotel for low maintenance travelers. So, if you are one of the many Trip Advisors who criticize hotels for a lack of room service choices, Wi-Fi internet access, chiffon robes or heated toilet seats, then you best look and book elsewhere. However, if you simply need basic accommodations to lay your head – and save money for Big Apple adventures – then the Latham Hotel is the place for you. Second to the price is the location; perfectly situated in Midtown off Fifth Avenue and only a few steps away from where King Kong fell for Fay Wray (or Naomi Watts), the Latham guest will find himself or herself right in the middle of America’s greatest city. Sure, there are a few kinks: there is the bland, dimly-lit lobby reminiscent more of a hospital waiting room in some third world nation; there is the ancient elevator that slooooowly takes you to your floor where a maze of narrow hallways await. The room will leave you completely underwhelmed. That said, I found mine comfortable and provided enough room. What amenities there were consisted of a few thin bath towels, a miniscule vial of industrial shampoo and a sliver of plastic-wrapped soap. If you have sensitive hair or skin, it would be practical to bring your own shampoo and soap. And since the building is old and has the plumbing to match, you should let the shower – which is actually a tub with a flimsy wrap-around curtain - run for a few minutes. There is television with basic cable, but you didn’t come here to watch TV, did you? So, does this really matter? After all, you’re in New York and a short walk away from its’ many sights and sounds. While there is no onsite restaurant for breakfast, there is the Café 28 next door, where you can get an early morning coffee or a late night Panini, since its open 24 hours. If you need a quick pint, there is, a few blocks north, an Irish pub called Rattle N Hum. It offers about 20 draught beers. And a few blocks east is the Lexington Avenue subway. Check it out. Then hit the town with a few extra bucks in your pocket. The Latham Hotel is for people who want to see New York City – and not 35 channels on TV. And, so what if the room has no electric walking stick polisher?

Reviews.Title: “very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: boozie33
Reviews.Content: was a bit worried when i booked this hotel as it is a hotel/hostel. but on arrival could b more pleased with the service we recieved. lovely staff, very helpfull, room was small but enough as when visiting a city like new york u r not there to spend ur time in a room.clean towels n freshly made beds everyday. was a central place to stay,

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Xena88
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review very late. But I am on my way back to the Latham in one week. I stayed in Jan 08 for 14 days. It is a great location and i enjoyed all of the staff there!! Stephen was a breath of fresh air. JP was also an awesome fellow. Along with many more of the staff. My room was cleaned when ever i needed it to be. And anything that i asked for there was someone to help out. Also they were doing some renos to the hallway and i never heard them at all. They gave me good information on shopping and for laundry places . My experience in NYC at the Latham was just Awesome! Thanks Stephen and Staff. See you in one week. Sherry from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad room”
Reviews.Author: soph9933
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 'hotel' for 3 nights. The first night was awful, the heating was too hot so we did not get any sleep. Me and my friend had to share a double bed, there was also a single bed and a camp bed in the room for my other 2 friends. It was only supposed to be a double room.We were told we were going to have a room with 4 bunk beds, so a double room was a shock. You coudn't move around the room because of the extra beds, this must have been a fire hazard. We could hardly get through into the bathroom. The room was quite clean but the floor could have done with a good hoovering. There was nowhere to hang clothes so we had to keep everything in our suitcases - locked as it was not very safe. I think they use the hotel for social housing as well. The only good thing about it was the location.

Reviews.Title: “affordable and perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: irishlad101
Reviews.Content: I don't really know what some people on here think they are getting for the price. I stayed at the latham from the 17th to 24th November 2008 and found it the perfect base for my stay in New York. It is wonderfully located and very reasonable at the price. The staff when I had reason to ask them anything were always very helpful(especially in arranging my transfer to jfk) and when I came back each evening from running round the city my room was spotless. I chose the shared bathroom option and never had any problem with it as it was clean each morning and night when i needed it. The room was warm to the point of been too warm but aside from that I have no complaints about the Latham and am planning a return whenever I have enough for another trip to New York

Reviews.Title: “A good base for the city that never sleeps!”
Reviews.Author: BrightonStar
Reviews.Content: The reality in life is you get what you pay for. I stayed at the Latham in February of this year with my partner. We stayed in a room with a private bathroom, we had fresh towels each day, the room was cleaned daily and when a bottle of beer exploded on the bed, I called reception and they changed the linen immediately! The staff were friendly and although the city use some of the rooms as social housing, none of the residents gave us any problems, in fact, the opposite. The location is amazing, a couple of blocks from the empire state building and the flat iron, the deli on the corner (deli 28) is amazing and definitely worth a visit or three. If you want luxury, pay more.. if you want a base for the city that never sleeps, I'd recommend the Latham

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: greenhouseireland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Nov. and did not feel safe. Luggage left in the hall, for anyone to have access to. Brought valubles with us when we went out. Got show pent house when we arrived. Absolutely filthy, and asked to be changed to another room. Very pokey. Put up Do not disturb sign on the door, so no one would have access. Dreadful place. This is not a hotel, more like a tenement house, lots of children around. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful stay”
Reviews.Author: Trez75
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby looked liked something out of a movie where the good cops have to see a suspect on the bad side of towm. Im pretty sure that the place is used as social housing. The room was small and dirty. The bed was a camp bed frame with an old lumpy mattress and threadbare sheets and a thin rough blanket. The bathroom was dirty, cracked tiles, peeling paint. It was constantly noisy and just a really unpleasant place to be. We were booked in for 4 nights, but only stayed for one. Only nice thing I can say about the place is that they only charged us for two nights Went and found another hotel round the corner (The Ramada) that was considerably nicer and only about $20 a night more. Avoid this hotel at all costs

Reviews.Title: “We had a mouse”
Reviews.Author: hellokitty82
Reviews.Content: Well, the hotel was ok 4 the first 2 nights untill we found a mouse had been in our room. The hotel gave us somes chocolates when we arrived at the hotel, Which was v nice of them. We ate some then left them by the tv. A couple of days later we found little piles of chewed up chocolates in several places in the room, and the tv ariel had come out of its socket (i no that this was def in b4 i went to bed as i had been watching tv the night b4 and had not removed it). We got ready and went down stairs to tell the people at the desk.They told us to come back that evening and speak to the manager, so we did. He kindly moved us to another room on a higher floor, a bit noisey but liveable. He also asked us to speak to him b4 we left. We approached him on the evening we checked out and he told us that he was again v sorry and would definatly refund us a nights stay at the hotel for our inconvenience. He was'nt v professional and didnt give us his name or confirmation of this, he appeared to be rushing us along. We still to this day, and after an email from the travel agent i booked with have sent him an email NOT been refunded a penny. Be v careful when booking with this hotel, it's v basic and a bit noisey at times. It definatly has character and conterary to what people say they do speak english, ok some do better than others. Check the lock on your door ( ours was a bit dodgy when we got there, but was fixed immediatly). It is clean and the baths arnt that bad. The women living at the hotel are v nice and didnt cause us any problems. I would think twice about saying in this hotel again and would only use it again if it had to be a last resort. If the manager is to read this i would appriciate it if you would refund my nights stay u should still have my details i stayed twnetieth to the twenty fifth of nov 2008 under the name of roters

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous, awful, terrible, the worst ever!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dishyuk
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived on the 02/02/09 after being delayed at London Heathrow for 12 hours due to the bad weather. We were met by a male on reception who did not appear to want to talk to us at all. He demanded our passports with no please or thank (i've got no airs or graces and neither does my partner but come on, common courtesy), he then requested my partner pay the outstanding bill which we began to do when my partner queried the final balance, he replied that was the cost and basically end of discussion. My partner produced a copy of the email we had received with the final balance on it and yes we knew they were tax's to be added on but he was saying there was another local tax, which my partner advised he wanted to know why it wasn't included in the bill. The hotel manager appeared and began to patronise us by stating we obviously had got confused and mixed up by euros when 1. euro's is not america’s currency and 2. is not the uk's either! We assured him we were not confused and had received the email which we advised we would show him. The manager left to go home and we advised the male behind the desk we would pay what we had been told and discuss it with the manager the following day. The male advised he would not take any money and requested we 'check our room' to make sure we were 'happy before paying'. I mean what kind of hotel needs to ask you to do that first.... we soon found out why! We were taken to our room by a russian (we think) maintenance guy who spoke broken english and who appeared frustrated. On first impression the room was ok, small but ok, it was really cold and after 5 minutes we realised there was NO hot water AT ALL and NO heating! Now this isn't a cheap cheap hotel, we paid over $930 for 1 week (obviously the current exchange rate increased the cost) and i think it's fair to say hot water is a basic amenity. We went back down to reception and told the male we were not happy with the room and he started to question the maintenance guy as though we were lying, who assured him there was no hot water or heating. We were given a key to room 421, which was even smaller but appeared fine, after 6 minutes of running the water it heated up. Although by this time the maintenance guy was so wound up he was raising his voice telling us 'take the room, it's ok'!. We did take the room we were so exhausted we didn't have the energy to argue. I must admit I am a deep deep sleeper and therefore I never hear anything at night but my partner wakes on every sound but this hotel seriously takes the biscuit! It's not a hotel or a hostel, it's like some kind of single mother accommodation ( and i am not saying there's anything wrong with that) but we paid for a hotel and you expect some kind of noice control but there were kids and babies everywhere, noise constantly (which you expect in the streets of new york) but not in your hotel. The lift never worked, we always took the stairs which we never minded until checking out and had to wait 16 minutes, there was no way i was letting my partner lug our cases down 4 flights of stairs! Anyway we pretty much left around 9am everyday, came back around 5-6ish for a shower (which still took a good 5-6minutes to heat up) and went back out again until at least 1am. But when we were there we did not feel safe, we kept all our valuables on us and kept the do not disturb sign on the door to try and prevent any cleaners in our room (im sorry but we really didn't trust the place). On the 4th day, we came home to have a shower before going out for dinner and i swear to god i almost had a heart attack there was a massive cockroach crawling along the bathroom floor (i was hysterical) my partner killed it, and managed to calm me down. I went out that evening without showering or washing my hair I was so freaked out. Also my partner had bites on the backs of his arms and i had 3 between my thighs, which must have been from the bed. There was a vent beside the window which you couldn't close and it had freezing cold air from outside blowing in, my partner stuffed it with a few of his t-shirts which helped. Now i feel the cold easily but my partner is always warm and he even thought the room was freezing. On our last day were went down to check out at 12 and planned to leave our cases in the hotel until our flight that evening. The baggage is stored in reception and has a kind of guard around it, whilst my partner waited to speak to the female receptionist, i took it upon myself to unclip the guard and push our suitcases in. Now there was a sign on the wall (which i actually never saw and didn't even read afterwards) but the female in reception shouted over at me 'hey you, you can't go in there, get out'. I replied that i didn't realise and she got so annoyed with me saying I had no business going in there and it was against security telling me to 'read the notice on the wall'. I assured her again I didn't see the sign and advised I wasn't stealing anything. By now she was well and truly peeved off. Shaking her head at me, I was now really annoyed and asked 'what her problem was', she replied 'your attitude is my problem'. My partner asked who she thought she was speaking to and she replied 'she gave me attitude so she is getting it back'. She then proceeded to tell us we owed an outstanding balance of $13, which my partner said no chance! It was from the tax which we had queried on the first night, my partner requested she got the manager who came appeared and said to my partner 'sir you have been complaining since you arrived'!! We both were totally shocked and advised we complained on out first night because we had no hot water or heating and hadn't complained since even though we had cold air blowing in our room, cockroaches and constant noise!!!! He initially refused to go through the tax's with us and I queried whether he all guests are treated like dirt and not able to query their bill! Meanwhile the female is still giving us attitude and slagging me off right in front of me! I had lost it by now and told her to shut her mouth. The manager then advised he would pay the outstanding $13 but wouldn't let us leave our luggage, to which my partner told him yes we were!! The manager then advised if we did not leave he would call the police because we were being verbally abusive!! Now im from glasgow and if i had verbally abused anyone they would have known about it. My partner and I are both professionals and we did not at any point use threats, swear or even raise our voices ( we certainly wanted to). We advised him to ring the police, which he obviously thought would have scared us, so he picked up the phone and called them!! Advising the police switchboard he had 2 guests being verbally abusive!! So nowadays, querying your bill and challenging bad service and manners is perceived as being verbally abusive!! The female started giving attitude again, when suddenly the manager must of had a reality check, realising how ridiculous he was ringing the police and told us to forget the $13, he would let us leave our bags and told us to enjoy our day. It was the most ridiculous situation either of us have ever been in! Afterwards talking with my partner we came to the conclusion he must have people complaining all the time and lost the plot. I have not exaggerated at any point and am telling 100% the truth. The location was excellent and the gourment deli, cafe 28 on the corner was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: mingay
Reviews.Content: hi me and my boyfriend stayed at latham hotel the location was the best rite near 5th avenue and all the fab shops. The room was very small and dark but bed was ok the lift never worked but for the money it as good. I payed to have a private barthroom in my room but the toilet did'nt flush. My advise is stay at latham hotel if u want a cheap stay. Staff were very friendly and helpful. ps. Would go back for the location.

Reviews.Title: “a GREAT! find [for the cost]”
Reviews.Author: WanderingTravelerNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Friday the 2nd, and Saturday the 3rd. My room was located on the 11th floor and had a shared bathroom. There was a double bed, a television that sat upon a dresser drawer for clothing, sink with cabinet/mirror filled with toiletries, closet with hangers for my additional clothing. The room had a phone and a remote control for the television also. It was fairly quiet for the duration of my stay at Latham Hotel. If you are looking for a "1" star hotel in NYC - then this is the hotel for you. Having a shared bathroom wasn't a problem either - I didn't have to wait at all. There is also a great deli just around the corner from the hotel, they have many choices to choose from!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth bothering with”
Reviews.Author: Borderer
Reviews.Content: I know there are mixed reviews about this hotel so I'll give you our opinion on the hotel,spend a few pounds more & stay in somewhere a lot better. The hotel is about 2 miles away from most of the main tourist attractions ,except the Empire State Building which is a few blocks away.However the hotel cannot even be described as budget,there were 4 of us in a very cramped room with bunkbeds for 2 adults & 2 children & 5 suitcases & you would be lucky to swing a cat, there was a nice clawfoot bath but no plug in it.When we asked for one & some extra pillows we felt like we were imposing on them,although mostly the staff were helpful. As has been said the deli on the corner is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Did not love it but would stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: Stiinna
Reviews.Content: The room was really really small and they could maybe clean there a bit better, but for that price (80 USD a night) and with that location it was not so bad. We shared the bathroom on that floor, that was ok, we never needed to line up there and at least they cleaned the bathroom well. It was nice and quiet at the hotel, we had no problems there. Service was not really that good, I think I never saw anyone from the staff actually smile there. But if you just need a place to sleep in Latham is a good option. Only a short walk from the hotel to for example Macys' & Empire State building and it's easy to go everywhere from there with the subway.

Reviews.Title: “If you value your health/life/good time do not stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chez4226
Reviews.Content: DON`T DO IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! If your used to hell holes when on holiday then fine, this hotel states in all descriptions that its basic - fair enough - but nothing could of prepared us for what we found on arrival. I don`t see how anyone can call this a hotel I would call it a doss house/half way house/hostel certainly not a hotel. We stayed one night of our booked 5 nights and on the 2nd day promptly moved to alternative accommodation. Yes its cheap yes its a great location but unfortunately thats all it has going for it!!!! Filthy dirty disgusting so old fashioned and did not feel safe at all - I don`t care what the general manager replies to all these reviews what we are ALL saying is completely true. We were covered in bed bug bites the day we left beds were disgusting. The doors to the rooms were in no way secure and could of been kicked in so easily, did not feel safe at all. Why anyone would want to stay in a hotel that is also a half way house for residents (single mothers with loud children) is beyond my belief. My husband and I do not mind basic accommodation which we have stayed in before but the latham is something else. You get what you pay for and in new york I would rather pay double even triple the money to be in any hotel other than this one. we actually ended up staying at the waldorf astoria as my husband ended up paying the extra for this hotel for my christmas present and obviously that hotel is so so so expensive but it was worth every penny!!! You don`t even have to stay anywere as nice as the waldorf but it will still be 100 times better than latham, one thing i would say is that the staff were lovely but thats about it. we decided that if we stayed there we would not enjoy a single minute of our trip and new york is not somewhere you are likely to visit again so the waldorf was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad little Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: trbalmum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for Five nights in the beginning of december. The room was clean and a fair size for a twin enough storage space for myself and my sons belongings. We shared the bathroom which was clean and nearly always available no real long waits. complimentary shampoo and soap was supplied. Great location two minutes from the flat Iron building a five minute walk to the Empire state building close to the subway. Lift a little slow but you can always walk, a few residents but always polite Over all a good location hotel for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “exactly as expected”
Reviews.Author: MazzerP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Latham for two nights - a quick stopover after arriving from the UK in the evening. I had read many of the reviews on this site before booking so was under no illusions as to what to expect. Check in was efficient and no problem. Nice man to help me with my case in the rather quaint lift. My room was roasting hot (as mentioned in another review) but fortunately I had two windows I could open. I wasn't after a room with a view so wasn't disappointed. The room was a bit dated in decor, but clean and comfortable. The shared bathroom was always clean and had a great shower. I did find I had to wait for it a few times though - pity there wasn't a separate toilet from the shower room. It was never for longer than minutes though. I came across some of the mothers and children in the lift and corridors and found them really friendly and chatty. If I stayed in this hotel (or one like it) again it would definitely have to be with a private bathroom. Not cause the shared one wasn't clean/working - but more because I have realised (at 35) that I am too old to have to wander along a corridor in my PJs in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom - locking and unlocking doors en route! This doesn't mean that I wouldn't recommend it however. I found the Latham Hotel exactly as it advertises itself - clean, comfortable and very very convenient for the sights of NY. If you want more luxurious surroundings ..you will have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for New York City”
Reviews.Author: ButterflyEffect
Reviews.Content: Latham Hotel is a cenrally located hotel in Manhattan. The room we had was very basic with a tv, sink, bedside table, closet and bed. The bed was a little bit hard but it did the job. We shared a bathroom with the entire floor which was sometimes a problem. I walked from the 12th floor to the 7th floor and every bathroom was occupied. Luckily by the time I climbed back to the top the 12th floor was available. To their credit the bathrooms were very clean. Annoyingly, they charge for wireless internet ($3 for half an hour) which was unusual since all the other hotels I have stayed in in the US and Canada have had free wi-fi. The hallways also smelt sometimes, and the elevators were slow. My friend was waitig for the elevator one morning, and I walked from the 12th floor to the lobby via the stairs and beat him by about 5 minutes. If you want somewhere cheap and centrally located in NYC then this place is probably for you. It's not a rip off for what it is but you could stay at somewhere much nicer for the same price in a different city.

Reviews.Title: “Cute place in the city!”
Reviews.Author: gypsysc2
Reviews.Content: My friend and I wanted a fairly cheap place to stay in the city for a weekend, and everything was booked when I started to plan 3 weeks in advance, so I was thrilled when I found a site that I could book the Latham through. Location is great, of course...most places are walking distance, and there is a subway stop a few yards away. We also discovered lots of great Indian restaurants a couple streets down on our last day. The hotel itself was budget, and if you expect everything to be new and perfect, it probably isn't for you. If you want somewhere affordable, clean, friendly, and charming, it is perfect! We booked a room with the bathroom down the hall, and had no problems with it being too busy, just had to wait a couple of minutes once. The room was smallish and the windows faced out to the building next door, but it wasn't like there wasn't space for everything anybody could need to do in a hotel room. The elevator was slow, but it worked fine for getting luggage up, and using the stairs the rest of the time isn't much of a hardship for the price. It isn't luxury, but it is clean, comfortable, and cheap! Service was also great, everyone was very friendly, which made our stay there much better than lots of times I've stayed at big chain places.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: roundtrip08
Reviews.Content: The Latham Hotel is well situated in midtown manhatten just around the corner from the flatiron building. The room was better than we expected; it was clean with air conditioning, tv and sink. A couple of slight negative points is that all the electrical items in the room were plugged into one socket which kept shorting out and having to be reset. Also the place could do with more bathrooms as there is only one bathroom on each floor. Overall I would reccommend this as a good value place to stay if you are not looking for luxurious surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel, right in centre of Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: Rainbowkath
Reviews.Content: Read some mixed reviews about the Latham, but went with open mind as the price suited us. On arrival, noticed a few women with babies /toddlers in pushchairs outside hotel, but they didn't pose any problems, also came across a few whilst waiting for lift during our stay, but again no problems. staff very helpful and polite as we checked in. We had requested 2 adoining rooms (both with private bathroom facilities) but this wasn't posssible, and our rooms were on 5th and 6th floors. We were told that we could bring our luggage down the following day, as they had people checking out, and they would try and accomodate us; but we decided we were ok ass we were. Rooms (one double bedded and one with bunks) were clean, although on the smallish side, Both faced onto brick walls! Air conditioning adequate but noisy, especially at night. Theres a nightclub next door to Latham, but never heard anything from it. Situatiuon of Latham is excellent. Walk to end of street (just a hundred or so yards) and theres the Empire State Building! You are able to buy tickets at hotel for hop on Hop off buses., safetly deposit boxes re available at $3 a night, the reception staff will order taxis for you (but never had a problem getting one at end of street) After checking out you can store your luggage at hotel, and they will book your airport transport for you. The Latham is what it says on the box! A budget hotel right in the centre of Manhatten

Reviews.Title: “You know the old saying " Dont let the bed bugs bite?"”
Reviews.Author: WorldTour85
Reviews.Content: Well they did.. resulting in 42 bites over my body! What started out as an exciting trip to New York turned out to be a disaster! Firstly, we had been travelling for 8 hours on a plane and then an hour in the taxi to get to the Latham only to discover that the hotel had no record of my reservation that I made in March ( 4 months before our arrival) which I had a printed confirmation for and a deposit deducted from my credit card. The gentleman at the front desk could not speak english well at all and we had to wait 45 minutes for him to create a new reservation! The next morning we approached a new person at the desk and they promtly found our reservation straight away. Irritating. This place went from bad to worse when the elevator rarely worked and took about 20 minutes to wait for. We found it alot quicker to walk down the stairs from 9 floors up! When showering with a shower head being held up what looked like sticky tape and only spraying in one direction (out of the shower and on to the floor!) When trying to get wet the bath would rock from side to side, not being on even ground obviously. Then to my absolute delight on our way to Mexico (our next destination) I discoverd I had 42 bed bug bites all over me. Which might I add are still there after 22 days. I originally thought that 2 nights would not be long enough in New York.. but for me 20 minutes was long enough in this place. I will however give a shout out to the lovely lady at the front desk the next morning who found our reservation promptly and efficiently, its good to know that some of your staff are well trained. After travelling around Europe for 2 months prior to our arrival in New York and staying in Hostels ..they were 5 star compared to this hotel. We were very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: MumMc
Reviews.Content: Much better than expected. No it’s not the Ritz, yes it is old and a bit shabby, but we chose the Latham for good price and location and were very happy with both. The staff were very helpful, and the place VERY clean. Our family of mum dad and 3 adult children were happy to stay at Latham and would do so again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kegsy_baby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and my partner and I thought it was great for the money. OK, so its most definitely not for those who like a bit of luxury! 1. Great midtown location - turn left at the hotel, walk a few steps and you are on 5th Avenue. look to your right and the Empire State Building is just a 5-10 minute walk. There's a great deli on the corner which is open 24 hours. 20 minute leisurely walk to Times square. Plenty of amenities close by like laundry service, barbers etc. 2. They have air-con! In the middle of a humid summer you will be needing this! We had a problem with the electrics in our room; if you had the TV and air con on at the same time, the power would go off. We told reception and they immediately moved us to a larger room, no problems! 3. The rooms are small. But then so is everything in Manhattan. But there are plenty of drawers, bedside lockers, closet. The bathroom is small but we got used to it. 4. Really friendly staff!! 5. This hotel is used as temporary accommodation for single mothers and their children. DON'T BE PUT OFF BY THIS. They are friendly, and no problem at all. 6. Really slow lifts!! At the end of the day, no one is in NYC to stay in their room; if you need somewhere thats safe, in a good location, and don't mind basic accommodation, low price then this is the place for you. If you like a bit more luxury, then its not!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: kweenshaker
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Latham for 2 nights because we were having trouble finding last-minute budget accomodation for the first part of our trip. The 3 of us stayed in a tiny room with 2 bunkbeds (4 beds in all) and a private bathroom. The beds weren't the most comfortable, but I don't really expect 5* comfort in a bunkbed! The bathroom was tiny, but looked new and was immaculate. The elevator was SOOOO slow - we ended up taking the stairs a lot even though we were on the 7th floor. We didn't see many people in the hotel other than in the lobby. The lobby is clean but could use a facelift. Like others said, there are quite a few low-income mothers with small children living in the hotel, but everyone I saw seemed friendly and the kids were well behaved. Most said hello and some even insisted we take the small elevator even when they were waiting before we got there. I don't know why anyone would complain about these people. That said, the hotel is in an ok location, though I find midtown to be very impersonal. I would rather stay in one of the smaller neighbourhoods like Greenwich village or Chelsea. The Latham hotel is no beauty by any means, but does the job for anyone needing a budget hotel in Midtown Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “I liked the Latham!”
Reviews.Author: Cre3pyTie
Reviews.Content: Like most people who read this site, I was also worried about the hotel beacuse of the mixed reviews. I knew I wouldnt expect a 5-star hotel for the price of a 1-star. Overall I was satisfied with the Latham experience: the room was clean (and made up everyday as it should be), with a 21" TV, the bathroom (private) worked well and it was pretty neat, the airconditioner working perfectly and was enough to cool us off in the hot summer in NYC. The room is indeed old and dated, but again, I wasnt expecting a top-notch one with this price. Needless to talk about the location, its great: right on the corner of the 5th avenue, 2 blocks away from the subway in either direction, and close to great places to dine like Subway, Quiznos, Starbucks, Taco Bell :D Ah, and I cant forget to say about the "Cafe 28", a deli right in the corner which is open 24/7 and offers a great variety of options for breakfast or any meal. My conclusion is the mixed reviews are most likely due to different rooms but mainly different expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: Silviaround
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good position but I think is the worst hotel in the city! At the reception at our arrival there was a man smashing a big cockroach. The elevator doesn't work very well and it'all twisted. The room was smelly of an unidentified substance, very small, noisy and with dirty sheets. The bathroom was so little that you couldn't stand in front of the toilet. The door of the room could easily be opened with a kick. It was quite scary to sleep there! The price is low but i would have spent more to go anywhere else. (Actually we cancelled the other night booking). If you go to Eastgate tower is 1000 times better!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price and GREAT Location !!”
Reviews.Author: Jeannine2708
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Latham last week and must say I was rather pleased and positively surprised. First the hotel is great for the price ( I rather spend my money shopping in New York and not on a hotel room where you basically only sleep anyway) and the location is perfect. In a few minutes you're at Macys and on 34th and Times Square is only about 5 minutes by bus as well. There's a Deli, Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts within a few feet of the hotel door. I've stayed in other hotels with shared baths before with rather bad experiences, but the Latham's bathroom was cleaned several times a day it seemed and I never once found it occupied when I needed it. The room was relatively big for NY standards and for this type of hotel and even had a queen bed, which was comfortable and clean. There was no closet to hang clothes, but there was enough space to leave the suitcases open on the floor, so that's OK. The staff at the reception was very nice and helpful and the security guards are very friendly. The building seems to house a shelter for young mothers as well, but that doesn't bother at all. On the contrary, you get to meet nice people and chat with them :o) !! All in all I can only recommend this hotel. If you d'ont expect a five star luxury hotel, you're getting more than what you paid for and after all NY is about location more than comfort and I'm sure most people rather spend their money shopping than paying over 300$ a night for a hotel where you only spend a few hours a night anyway !

Reviews.Title: “definitely worth the money”
Reviews.Author: easyoung
Reviews.Content: the best part of this hotel/hostel is the service. the people there went out of their way to be accomodating. i arrived at 8:30 in the morning from a hellish bus trip and a long walk through manhattan to the hotel. they put us in our room at 9 a.m., 6 hours early, and i was greatly, greatly appreciative. they helped us with subway directions and other questions and what they didn't know, they looked up on the internet. the room was small, but clean and the bed was fine. there was a washbasin, cable tv, and a/c. it was always cool in the room, which i greatly apprecited. we had a key to the bathroom, which was right across the hall and was clean and roomy. the hall was quiet and we didn't hear anyone around us, even late at night and early in the morning. the latham has a lot of funky qualities that give it a lot of character. they have a private, old timey elevator that is operated by an employee during the day time hours. they play eclectic music in the lobby and you can check your baggage for no fee. next door is a chinese restaurant and next to that is a grocery/bodega. the hotel is right b/w 5th and Madison in the financial district and seemed clean and safe. subways are 2 blocks in either direction, which makes for an easy walk and the empire state building is just a few blocks from the hotel as well. we walked back from the subway at ll pm and felt safe on the street. the price was also a huge, huge bargain...$84 with tax for us. i am no spring chicken (51), so this isn't just a place for young people and other than sharing a bathroom, it was like a regular older hotel. i would highly recommend it! if i come back to nyc again, i would certainly stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but clean and comfy!”
Reviews.Author: Shoegal81
Reviews.Content: I booked the latham hotel as park of a package trip to NY for my sisters birthday, so i was pleased to find the total trip was within my budget, however after booking then reading some of the reviews about it, i was very nervous, esp since my sister can be a bit of a princess at times, and we had a shared bathroom! the latham was a very pleasant experience for us, on arrival we were checked in quickly, given the choice of a room with 2 single beds or one double, we chose the two singles, as we were advised that the room was slightly larger. The room itself was small, (on the 9th floor)but with a large cupboard for clothes and our 4 large suitcases. The view wasnt great ,it looked onto another building. The air conditioning worked very well, we had temps into the 80s when we visited so were very glad of it! the beds were very comfortable, with fresh sheets, and we had fresh towels everyday, as well as the room tidied. The shared bathroom was large, and clean on every occaision bar one that we were in it, however this was late at night., and this was just a wet floor form someone showering, and forgot to take their underwear!lol I never had any problems having hot water or access, no que's or anything, i only ever saw one person using it, and this was when i came out. The staff were very helpful,the manager Stephen, in particular was very sweet,helping us book tours and answering some questions, and if we needed anything like hairdryers, directions etc, they helped out straight away. I definately didnt experienceany of the horror stories that other reviews have left! The hotel does have a lot of single mums, however all were polite and friendly and i never felt uneasy sharing a lift with any of them at any time. Its a bit outdated to descriminate against the young mothers just because they live in the hotel, they could just as well be other guests on a longer trip! The lift was slow but i we never had to wait any longer than 5 mins or it. The general deco of the hotel is outdated and yeah you can see paintwork needing redone but it is old.i honestly dont have any major complaints about this hotel, the staff were helpfull the facilities were clean and its location is absolutely fabulous! right beside the Empire State Building, and other major attractions. If you check in to the latham hotel and be realistic about the fact that you have booked a budget hotel and treat the staff the way you would like to be treated yourself, then you will enjoy your stay as i did! TIPs* when getting a taxi from JFK to Manhattan, make sure its a yellow cab, they have a flat rate of $45 we ended up in a black cab who charged $90!! And get the shuttle service back, its only $15 back to the airport and the hotel will book it for you! (well they did at the latham anyway!) Also try the brooklyn bagel Company on 5th avenu about 3/4 blocks up from East 28th st, their breakfasts are amazing, esp cream cheese and bacon bagels!(thanks Steven!)

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!”
Reviews.Author: natalie1980Essex
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from spending 10 nights in this hotel. I would never recommend this to anyone. Things that went wrong: No natural daylight, No storage for clothes, Telephone out of order, Only 1 thin pillow each, Bites from I presume bedbugs, Air-conditioning didn't work properly, When the aircon was on, dust and clumps of dirt flew through it. We had OVER 20 powercuts in 3 days, Windows didn't open. Good things; Location, Most of the staff were very helpful. The place was clean. If we could have found anywhere else in NY we would have moved, but we couldn't find anywhere. I've travelled in hostels and never stayed in a place as bad as this.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a WELFARE HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: uglychicano
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for those that want a place to take a crap, a shower, and sleep from 3am-9am then hit the town again. This is not just a tourist hotel but also serves as part of Icahn House which is a homeless shelter so there are some shady characters in and out of the hotel. Most of the residents are single mothers, but single mothers tend to have boyfriends and they are some shady characters hanging around outside. I assume the hotel takes this role so as to get a continuous flow of money from the city. Aside from fruitflies in the bedroom and the stench, it is all you can expect for the price. It is hard to find something else for the price but don't even try to stay here witha pretentious teenager like mine! Some staff were jerks and some were nice but its NYC so fuggedaboudit!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to worry about”
Reviews.Author: yoakeem
Reviews.Content: We were a party of four, staying in two rooms for five nights. A little bit worried about the rooms we arrived and were reliefed. Yes, the rooms are old and a litle bit worn, but they are clean and you get a lot for your money. We've been staying at more expensive hotels in NYC that were far worse. The elevator is not really slow, but one elevator for all the guests and the residents makes it busy. Most of the time it worked just fine, and when it was at most busy we never had to wait more than maximum 3-4 minutes to get to or room on 11th floor. The staff were as friendly as they can be. The location is perfect so if you're not planning on spending your time in NYC in your room all day, I can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very cheap, but yoy get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Johanne77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for eight nights, which was not bad at all. It's hard to beat a double room for 90 dollars a night in central Manhattan. The location is fantastic, just a few blocks from Empire state building. The rooms were quite all right, a bit old and worn, but otherwise fine. I guess you get what you pay for. I personally would not have opted for the shared bathroom again. With one shower and one toilet (in the same room) on each floor, you had to wait in line for some time each morning. The staff was mostly friendly and helpful, and there is a computer with free use Internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “If youre not uptight...you'll be fine”
Reviews.Author: 5isenuf
Reviews.Content: If you arent uptight and need a decent place to crash each night, the Latham will meet your needs! If youre a nit picker, clean freak, high expectations kind of person, run far away. We stayed May 10th-13th. Heres the breakdown of the good, the bad, and the ugly. GOOD: - Great location, close to Subway, Great Cafe/Store on corner, and close to a few sights. - Cheap! Well, we didnt think it was cheap for where we came from but for NYC, its a bargain! - Clean, Our room was turned down each morning with fresh towels, linens, etc. No bugs in our room. - Pretty Quiet, we didnt notice any noise from the neighbors or the club next door. - WIFI access - Free in lobby, $9.95 a night in room BAD: - Some staff were rude and acted like we were an inconvenience if we needed anything. - Not everyone is on the same page/lots of confusion. When we first arrived we were told to use the guest elevators, there was no operator in there so we did it ourselves, luckily my husband knew how! Then the next day, we called the guest elevator and the guy came down, opened the door and said "Yes?" as if he was confused on what we wanted! Then told us to use the residential elevator. - We need some repairs done in our room, had trouble getting those done. Asked to switch rooms, got attitude for it and lots of flack but they finally obliged. UGLY: - Very old - Pipes are covered in lots and lots of coats of paint as shown in photos here, chips in bathtubs, floors in need of repair, had to ask for tub drain plug. Tub had two different handles and a bolt for the spout.. Things are not attractive in the rooms, very basic standard need. Desperate need of carpet upgrades. The corridors are slightly haunting, dim lighted and spooky. - The bedding was less than appealing but it worked for covering up with at night. So your stay will depend on your attitude, keep your expectations on the low end and you may be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “No Bargain”
Reviews.Author: R_JPrescott
Reviews.Content: Instead of the booked double room, they tried to put us in a tiny room with two sets of bunkbeds with saggy springs and thin mattresses. The automatic elevator was out of order - for days and days. the only elevator had to be manually operated by the too few hotel staff. We were stranded on the 11tth floor 3 times in 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: happy023
Reviews.Content: I was SO nervous about staying here...we booked on Travelocity and did not find this website until after we had paid for the trip. After reading the reviews, I wanted to back out of this hotel but my husband talked me into sticking with it. I am so glad we ended up staying here! I am a bit of a princess and expect things to be clean and for employees to do their jobs...and my expectations were far exceeded at the Latham hotel. The people are so nice there, especially the man who operated the elevator. Yes, we did see the mom's with kids but being a mom myself, my heart felt for them and they were very nice. I don't really see what the big deal is with them being there, we only saw them briefly in the lobby area but not on our floor. We stayed on the 12th floor in a room with a private bath and it was just fine. We have stayed in many hotels in NY and this one was really no different than any other average hotel, except it was much cleaner and quieter (and cheaper!!!). The air conditioner in the room looked new and worked very well. Our floor was so very quiet, we literally did not hear a thing except for the hum of the air conditioner. It was definately the most quiet place we have ever stayed while in NY! The mattresses were old but very soft and the pillows were so fluffy just like home. The employees were more than happy to hold our bags until we checked in and even held them after we checked out since our flight did not leave until late that evening. What else can I say about this place? I think that as long as you know that this is not a luxury hotel but a very acceptable place to stay while in the great city of NY, you will be happy. And the price!! We were able to do so much shopping and dining with all of the money we saved by staying here! We will absolutely stay here again from now on and will recommend this place to anyone with confidence!

Reviews.Title: “Awesomeness”
Reviews.Author: MissNadzy
Reviews.Content: I knew from the moment I booked this hotel that is was going to bed great. I read most of the reviews I could find about this place and couldn't care less about the bad reviews. NYC has made me love bagels and wraps. Or at least that shop less than a minute at the corner of the hotel did. It was great! The price! The location and the PRICE! I couldn't believe it. The room was a little small and we didn't have a washroom but the shared washroom on our floor was hardly occupied. I felt like it was our own private bathroom. We only used the Elevator once since we were on the 4th floor so we never noticed if it was every slow. I will alway suggest this place to my friends and family who every venture off to NYC. Thank you Latham Hotel. Without you guys I think we would have to take the subway which would have taken away from all the great walking we did. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Fantastic, Very Cheap”
Reviews.Author: MichelleLeckie1983
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend booked into the Hotel on the 14th March and were straight away welcomed by one of the hotel employees. At the present time the hotel was really busy as there was a party checkin out. Not to worry tho we were seen at reception straight away. I was abit wary at first as the reception did ask if us to check the room first before checkin in. So up we went and i was totally amazed after reading some disheartned comments there was nothing to complain about the room was great. We had 2 big double beds in our room and ensuite bathroom what more could we ask for. The room was also very spacious to we had like a walk in cupoboard and a big set of chester drawers and bedside table which was great to store all our clothes away. Not to mention a big TV with 24 channels great to wake up to Good Morning America hahaha. We couldn't of chosen a better location to the left hotel was 5th Ave and to the right was Madison Ave. Empire State Building and Macy's roughly about a 5min walk. There is a deli on the corner of the hotel which does great croissants and all the fruit salad stuff looks great and fresh. There is a chinese next door that does great chow mein. You would hardly notice there was a nightclub next door as i never heard it once while i was there. Great pubs very close to the hotel, you will need to try Jack Dempsters very good well what i can remember. Our room was 1004 and i would definatley be coming back to this hotel, already got plans to return next year for St Patricks and will be returning with a larger group and i will be definatley be booking this hotel again. I would like to say a big thank you to all employess and Steve (Manager) at the Latham Hotel for there hospitality throughout my stay at your hotel, you made my stay enjoyable and i look forward to seeing you again. Michelle x

Reviews.Title: “Super Smashing Great”
Reviews.Author: Kerry1983
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 14th March around 4pm, the lobby was very busy as a party of 50 were checking out, but the staff managed to book us in quickly and as we were paying cash, we were asked to look over our room before paying. The location was amazing, 28th street between 4th and 5th avenue, very close to the empire state building, $6 taxi ride from Times Square, taxi to JFK cost around $60 in a town car, which the hotel reception staff ordered for us. The location really is amazing, not too far from all the major sightseeing at all. Directly next door to the hotel is a nightclub called Runway, which didn't disturb us at all. On the other side of the hotel is a small chinese take away with some tables, on our first day we ate some chow mein and it was very nice. Right on the corner of 5th Avenue and 28th Street there's a cafe called cafe 28, this place does EVERYTHING, I think it's open 24 hours, there's seating downstairs and upstairs, it's clean and has hot and cold buffet and made to order food too, it was our first port of call every morning for a hearty, and reasonably priced breakfast. Around the side of the empire state there is a great Irish Bar, where the banter is excellent, and is open until 4am, and 5 minutes walk to hotel. The room was spacious and clean, our room was 1004, on the 10th floor, it had two double beds, a private bathroom, the room was cleaned everyday, fresh sheets and towels, the carpet was hoovered every 2nd day I think. The beds were comfy and large, I slept soundly every night, although one night we did hear people talking in the corridor. There was also a cupboard for clothes to hang up, two shelves, a small bedside table, and a large chest of drawers - plenty of room for all our stuff. The people who permanently live in the hotel were friendly, if you said hello they said hello back, smiled and were polite. I would absolutely go back here, the hotel was everything we needed, reception staff would answer any questions we had. Steve, (I think he was the general manager) was very chatty to us, and told us to come back, that once we stayed at the Latham we were like family. We checked out on the 19th, and while we were waiting for our car, a member of reception asked if we meant to leave so much in our room (we left clothes, shoes, slippers, shampoo, hairspray - trying to make more space in our suitcases), she really didn't need to check with us, but I think staff genuinely care about their guests, and that to me is the most important factor to a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “the latham hotel is fine”
Reviews.Author: joolsSWales
Reviews.Content: just spent 4 nights at the latham hotel, what can i say it aint the ritscarlton but in saying that it was clean the staff were very frendly and helpfull, ok the lift was'nt the fastest and their was no hot water 4 a few hours on the 3rd day not the end of the world .the price was right the location was spot on i would stay there again .the hotel does seam to have a few single mothers staying their but dont let that put you off thay also were frendly . to the staff at the latham thanks

Reviews.Title: “I left but ended up paying”
Reviews.Author: CAE68Florida
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to this hotel, my friend and I noticed a drunk man in the lobby. We weren't sure if he was watching the door or loitering. We proceeded to ask to see the rooms before checking in, because it seemed shady. In the elevator, there were some women and children who spoke with us. They were very nice, but they were astonished that we would pay to stay at the "hotel" because it was a shelter. They warned us not to stay there, and proceeded to give us details why we should find another place. When we reached the hallway, it was somewhat dark, and there was loud music with bags of garbage in the hallway. Upon looking in the room, it did seem rough... and certainly not worth the money. We went back to the lobby and told them we were leaving. The desk clerk said that it was 1/2 a shelter, but that they were in the process of changing over to a hotel. I voiced my opinion that people should be told that when they book what is advertised as a hotel. The manager informed me that my card would still be charged, and after an exchange of words, I decided I would just dispute the charge when I got home. The two of us (female) and my child walked down the street toting our luggage. We had never been to NYC before, and we were confused as to what we could do now. It was Thanksgiving weekend, and we had no place to stay. A police officer gave us some suggestions, and a very nice lady gave us her number (in case we couldn't find any other place that night). New Yorkers were wonderful and helpful. The Best Western Presidential felt so bad for us that they matched the rate of the Latham. We had a wonderful stay in the heart of Broadway and a nice Thanksgiving afterall. The management can continue to counter every negative remark they receive, but the fact is that consumers should be told ahead of time if they are staying at a shelter. There needs to be some truth in advertising. I do not make a ton of money and going to NYC was a once in a lifetime chance. I found it very unfair to be tricked by a business. I am very thankful for the kindness of the Best Western. I did dispute the charge when I got home, and received 1/2 a credit from my credit card company - but I still ended up paying some money to a business that decieved me.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly above average for the money”
Reviews.Author: pigsonthewall
Reviews.Content: I just thought I'd better put in my two penn'orth, as there are conflicting reports about this hotel. Having read some of the negative comments about this hotel, we arrived with some trepidation. We needn't have worried. The hotel reception and staff were very welcoming, The room was clean. The bathroom and toilet were spotless. The location is excellent and very handy for seeing all the sites (believe me, you won't be staying in the hotel much, anyway). We'd just come off a Caribbean cruise on the Queen Mary 2, but the memorable part of the holiday was, for both of us, New York. The hotel certainly left no negative impressions, only positive ones. The Ritz, it ain't, but it has its NY charm. Regarding it doubling up as a hostel for unmarried mothers, so what? This isn't the Victorian era!!! Get real. The mothers we encountered were friendly and not out to pick your pockets. We even befriended one. So there you have it. Great location, clean room, WC and bathroom. Really friendly staff (honestly). We'd stop there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prettymocha
Reviews.Content: First off don't believe all this negativity some people just over do it.. When i walked in this hotel i was greeted by a very friendly and professional front desk and also the mgr who was sitting in front as well I was pleased when i arived that my room was ready a few hours early because I was tired from my long trip from California.. My room very clean i walked around with no socks the carpet looked new the TV was big about 25" and fairly new all the channels worked. The AC looked new it came with a remote control Pillows towels blankets spot free oder free I had a shared Bathroom it was clean but there are dirty people in the world but everything looked exact like the pictures on the website and my room was on the 8th floor room 816 there's no veiw but if your looking for one go outside duh I was walking distance to Times Square or a $5 trip in the taxi for you lazy folks there's room service very nice lady gave me extra towels etc... ... and the mothers with kids were not a problem kids were very cute behaved and never really seen them much. The nite club on Saturday nite I didn't hear the music but then again I was on the 8th floor All in All I loved my stay and will be back in July because Patrick and his Hotel is super cool and I payed $79 a night for my 3 night stay very very worth it..

Reviews.Title: “Very bad, stay away”
Reviews.Author: angelo79
Reviews.Content: dear people I went there at christmas and new year 2008. Very bad service, the bedroom was always cold,the heating didn't workt so well also the shower to. I am very sas about it, because i wend to new york city for a few times,but this hotel was the first time and also the last time for me. There are also a lot of children with there mom's,i mean it's like a care centre for single mothers. I have booked my hotel online, with hotelroom365 and they recommended me this hotel. friendly greets and i wish every one a good and nice trip to New york city

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: pollycobain
Reviews.Content: This was an ok hotel, very centric, good staff, slow elevator (old one) but worth it, it was very cheap!, the toilets was more than ok! And the mothers with children that lived there did not bother me at all. good temperature in the rooms..... I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bwfallon
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Latham Hotel. The room was clean. The room was warm (for my January stay). The TV worked well. The location was good. This hotel was about $200 less than other hotels. Considering that, it's an excellent value. The staff was great. The elevator was a little slow, but I was on the 5th floor so I walked up frequently. But, the friendly staff often used the service elevator to assist guests. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay at this hotel again... soon!

Reviews.Title: “great choice accomodation”
Reviews.Author: carsligo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i are from galway,Ireland and we stayed in this hotel for 5 nights, from the 12 th to 18th dec 07. I was worried because i had read bad reviews. I was pleasantly suprised on arriving everybody was welcoming. A porter took us and our bags to the room. we chose a shared bathroom because i wanted to save as much money as possible for shopping.The bed was big and so comfortable.the room was clean and cosy, the t.v was big and had loads of stations.No view from window...ahh who cares spent all dat outside shopping and touring only returned to sleep etc..sure we only sent about ten hours if even in the room apart from sleeping. Who wants to pay a small fortune to do that. Our bed was made and our room was tidied everyday. We also got new towels everyday which we did not even need because the radiator was so hot they were dry in ten mins,great if the ends of your trousers get wet from shopping.We had a sink and mirror in our room,soap and shampoo,and faceclothes.There was hairdryers available for free at front desk.Safety deposit box available for i think 2 dollars per day We usually showered at night in our bathroom down the hall and it always had piping hot water. Bathroom is like your own at home, its not cubicles or anything,just a shower,toilet and sink in one room.lovely.there is air con in the room if you are too warm at night.We stayed on 4th floor and could walk the stairs.With this hotel what you see on hotel pictures is exactly what you get. It is a hotel at hostel prices, the empires state building is around the corner, subway on corner. macys on 34th street is about a ten min walk. I will be staying here the next time i go to nyc. Staff will direct you anywhere you want to go and can organise a private car back to airport for $ 60. It only costs $50 on the way into the city from jfk in a yellow cab but apparently they have to by law charge that flat rate for visitors in to the city but on your return it is a different story they could charge you anything. So anyway, anybody who writes bad reviews on this place are snobs who like living in luxury, that were being "scrooges" that did not want to pay big bucks for a snazzi hotel and were disappointed when they arrived. I give latham the thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: scoobiedoo76
Reviews.Content: When my friend and I travelled to NYC last year, we knew that the hotel prices were going to be very expensive, so we opted for a budget stay at The Latham. After a late night flight from Las Vegas we checked into The Latham at around 12 midnight. On arrival we were greated by a nice reception desk and porter service. It was when we had to hop in the lift to our room when it all went down hill. Rubbish bags were stored in the lift and through-out the corridors of the hotel. The room was stuffy(as there was a storm during the day), but opening the window made little difference as the window faced a brick wall (little than 1 metre away). The tv reception was extremely poor. The bath in our ensuite was worn and the water pressure was non existant. We ended up staying at the hotel for 6 hours, feeling unsafe due to the yelling and noise of the shelter occupants. We called our travel agent in Australia and advised her that we were not staying any longer and to book another hotel. On departure after advising we were checking out, the receptionist was understanding and agreed to refund our pre-paid 3 nights stay. We ended up staying at a boutique hotel on broadway that cost around $250USD per night - but made the stay in NYC one to remember. If you are a backpacker or on a budget the Latham is fine - but otherwise spend the additional money to really enjoy NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best budget hotel In the heart of NYC.”
Reviews.Author: dreamerHarrisburg
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from NYC and spend 3 nights at Latham Hotel. Frankly speaking,I was freaked out when I read the bad reviews from various sources regarding the poor service& quality of the hotel. However,after spending few nights there, I find the hotel to be perfect and terrific (now I know those bad reviews were just big lies). The room is not disappointing and when I asked for an extra bed, it was provided free of charge and some one send it to my room less than 5 minutes. The shared bathroom is always clean and working in a good condition. Staff (Reception and housekeeping) are very friendly, polite and helpful. Yes, there are many single mother and children who resided in this hotel but they never bothered you at all(incl. their kids). It's one of the best hotel that I've ever stayed. There's a Chinese restaurant beside it which offer great food at reasonable prices. With it's extreme close location to Starbucks coffee, Burger King,Mcdonalds, Quiznos, Wendys, restaurants, short walk to Empire State building, Macy's, Subway, taxis everywhere, wireless internet access, What more could you ask for for less than USD.100/night in NYC. Nonetheless there are some rooms for improvement such as; -the elevator, maybe the hotel could add another one to reduce the waiting time in the future. -the network for wireless phone is not available inside the room (if it's available, it will be a really weak signal) -water boiler, it would be nice if the hotel guest can boil their own water using electric boiler w/o having to purchase mineral water from 24 hours store at high prices. In a nutshell, come and experience Latham Hotel for yourselves. you will never regret of choosing Latham as your hotel while you are in NYC. Thank you Latham Hotel for making my stay in NYC such a memorable one. I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: chrisxr2
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a week in New York staying over Christmas. I picked the hotel for its location as the reviews on here are mixed. We had a room on the 12th floor with a shared bathroom. The room was very clean and everything within was to a good standard, the shared bathroom was very clean and no where near as "busy" as we had expected. The staff were excellent, and very helpful, polite ang genuinely courteous. I went with my partner (Both 30) and had no gripes with the hotel, the mothers and children that are the full time residents, were lovely and the kids very well behaved. We had no problems with the lifts as has been mentioned in other write ups. The location is excellent the price is very competitive i would certainly stay here again, the only small thing was that the hotel is boiling hot, but we slept with our windows open which easily solved this. You will not find a better quality better located hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fl0ridaGuy
Reviews.Content: I am relocating to New York and simply needed a place to sleep while I spent my days apartment hunting. The Latham hotel was a great for my situation, as it is in a great location(situated right off of 5th Avenue), and extremely close to subway. I was able to catch the winter special rate for $80/night which was great, especially for that time of year. The young lady working the desk was extremely pleasant and provided assistance whenever needed. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone with a short stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasent suprise!”
Reviews.Author: RubyMoonboots
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for this hotel I was a little scared but I couldn't find anything else in the time I had or price range. Now that I have stayed there I am glad that I did. Arrival - I was little scared looked a bit run down from the outside as there was lots of scalfolding (but I now know that scalfolding is everywhere in NYC at the moment). My partner and I recieved a very pleasent welcome from the hotel front desk and someone even took our bags to the room for us. The Room - The room upon entering was very basic but looked clean. The first thing I did was pull the sheets up as I was scared to find bugs like some of the other reviews mentioned. I was happy though when i found brilliant white sheets and a brand new matress. :o) hurrah! I'm a hypo clean person so I even got down and checked under the bed and nooks and crannies for creepy crawlies but was pleased to find nothing. We had a telephone and a TV with lots of channels. One little thing was that the room got quite hot so I did resort to opening the window a little bit on one of the evenings. It was freezing outside so I shouldnt moan really. The Bathroom - Was a bit of a pain not having our own bathroom but it worked out ok. I was scared that it would be dirty etc but it wasnt. it looks exactly like the one on the hotel's website and is very nice. We had to wait a few times for the bathroom but not to long. (in fact one of the times I think I was waiting for nothing as i don't think i was turning the key properly! ha!) Never had issues with their being no hot water which i thought we would have. Anything else... This is a place for under priveledged women and their children and we did have a lady in the room next to us but they were very quiet and we probably made more noise than they did. thats my first ever review... hope you didnt get bored!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Service, Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: marty19
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of friends to New York for Thanksgiving, staying at The Latham Hotel for five nights. We had three en-suite rooms that were spotlessly clean, comfortable, warm and felt very safe. Although basic and the three rooms did have different highlights - one had a better bathroom whilst another was larger and had a better view - we all grew quite attached to the hotel during our stay. It is in an excellent location and the staff were great. The residents and children I met in the lift were friendly and polite and the only time I saw or heard a child get overly excited was when they saw the Christmas Tree in the reception area for the first time! Overall our experience of New York was wonderful. If you are looking for a budget hotel that offers excellent value for money you wont find much better than The Latham and it's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Charrua2010
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place - I thought it was and honest and decent hotel. The location is great, a couple of blocks from the subway. The property is old and that is clearly evident once you step inside, and it has not been gutted and renovated, it still has an old feel to it, but my room was extremely clean (it even smelled clean). The decor in minimal, but who cares, it's a place to sleep. And speaking of sleep, the bed was very comfortable. Not much of view, but if you want that in New York you have to expect to pay a heck of alot more than the $145 I payed, which I really think was a bargain. I did hear a child crying at night (I knew about the hotel being used by the city to shelter single mothers) but it was'nt late and it did'nt bother me too much. The TV was modern and had around 30 channels. I'd like to especially complement the staff at the Latham, they were very professional and helpfull, for a dollar they held on to my luggage after I checked out so I did'nt have to drag it around on my last day in NYC. I had booked a room with shared washroom but when I asked at the last minute if an ensuite room was available, I was given one for a very reasonable amount above my shared washroom rate. I will definately use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bedbugs.................”
Reviews.Author: FlCat
Reviews.Content: For $150.00 a night we expected a proper hotel.The Latham is not a proper hotel.The Latham is a halfway house for single mom's and a hotel.You can not focus on both.You should specialize in either one and give it your all.The two do not mix. The kid's are always screaming.The hot water is always gone. The hotel is dirty .The staff was preoccupied with one another .
